loans.name: El Gran Esfuerzo (Grupos 3, 7) Group

texts.en:
Juan is the coordinator of his group "El Gran Esfuerzo" (The Great Effort).  His story is representative of his group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally, many of whom have recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. His group is located in Hato Mayor, an agricultural area in the east of the country, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. He makes his home there in a simple structure with his long-term partner and their children.

Juan is excited to be taking his sixth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid his previous loans and grown his business. He plans to use this one to invest in his fuel business and to buy more gasoline and charcoal for sale. He will use the profits to make improvements to his house and buy school supplies for his children. Juan hopes this will contribute to the well-being of his family and to the education of his children. He thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy gasoline and charcoal.

loans.name: Bernarda Lucia

texts.es: Bernarda tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación, pues los financiamientos le han sido de mucha ayuda. Tiene 1 hijo que está a su cargo, La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta ropa nueva, hace más de 5 años, por eso vende prendas de vestir para damas, caballeros y niños, como blusas de licras, algodón, vestidos, jeans y otros. Actualmente llega la temporada fría por lo desea adquirir gran cantidad de ropas como camperas, suéter, pantalones y otros. Ya que ella desde muy joven se inicio a la venta de ropas y día a día va creciendo gracias a su esfuerzo. Es el destino del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de los productos que sus clientes le solicitan.
texts.en:
Bernarda has been working with Fundación Leon for a long time and the loans have been a great help. She has a young son. Bernarda has been selling new clothing for more than five years, which includes garments for women, men, and children such as spandex and cotton shirts, dresses, jeans, and other items. Now that the cold season has arrived, she wants to buy a greater amount of clothes such as jackets, sweaters, trousers, and other types of articles. Ever since she started selling clothes as a young woman, Bernarda has been able to grow every day thanks to her efforts.

This loan will be used as operating capital to buy products that her customers have requested.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to buy more clothing

loans.name: La Union Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Maricela tiene 35 años de edad, tiene un pequeño hijo, vive feliz junto con su pareja que la apoya en todo y su hijo en la zona de la libertad en el distrito de comas, al igual que sus 6 compañeras que forman parte del grupo "la unión", y fueron sus compañeros quienes la eligieron como presidenta de la junta directiva del grupo.

Hace seis años la sra. Maricela se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, y ultimamente apoya en un salon de belleza. Las necesidades familiares la animaron a buscar generarse un ingreso extra que pudiera ayudar en la economía del hogar, es así que empieza vendiendo productos de belleza por catalogo.

Gracias a su trabajo puede asumir algunos gastos personales yu apoyar a su esposo.

Su proxima meta es poner un salon de belleza por lo que se esfuerza mucho en su negocio.
El prestamo solicitado lo utilizará para pagar algunas deudas generadas por su negocio.
texts.en:
Maricela is 35 years old and has one small child. She lives happily in the Libertad area of the Comas District with her partner, who supports her in everything, and her son. Her 6 fellow members of the “La Unión” group also live in Libertad and elected her as president of the group’s management committee. Six years ago, Maricela began selling beauty products and lately has been helping in a beauty salon. The needs of her family motivated her to seek a way of earning additional income to contribute to the household finances, which is how she started selling mail-order beauty products. Thanks to her work she can meet some personal expenses and also help her husband. Her next goal is to set up a beauty salon, so she is working very hard in her current business. The loan requested will be used to pay some debts generated by her business.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Stansfield, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will use the loan to pay business debts

loans.name: María

texts.es: María tiene 43 años vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposo y sus dos hijas. Ella siempre ha sido una mujer muy trabajadora y es por ello que quiere mejorar su negocio. El trabajo al que se dedica es la venta de bijouterie, sujetadores de cabello (que ella misma elabora con ayuda de su hija), lleva 5 años en esta actividad y hasta el momento le ha dado buenos resultados en la venta. Su negocio esta instalado en un pequeño espacio dentro del  puesto de venta de una amiga, ahí es donde ofrece bonitas y variadas bijouterie como: aretes, anillos, pulseras, y toda clase de adornos de fantasía. La ventaja de su trabajo es que puede disponer del tiempo que necesita para poder cuidar a sus hijas, pues ellas necesitan de toda su atención. Su mayor anhelo es tener un gran local o una tienda, pero para ello le hace falta de mucho presupuesto para conseguirlo, además la zona en la que ella vive es un poco alejada y no comercial, María sabe que con el tiempo y la ayuda de su familia podrán realizar grandes cosas. Este es su primer crédito con MFP y se compromete a ser muy puntual con todos los pagos de las cuotas. Con el crédito que solicita, espera poder comprar más mercadería y así aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
María is 43 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and her two children. She has always been a very hardworking woman and for this reason she wants to improve her business. She sells jewelry and hair clips which she makes herself along with the help of her daughter. She has spent 5 years on this activity and until now sales have been good. Her business is set up in a small space inside a friend's shop. This is where she offers pretty assorted jewelry like earrings, rings, bracelets and all kinds of costume jewelry. The advantage of her work is that she can have the time that she needs to be able to care for her children since they require her full attention. Her greatest wish is to have a large store but she lacks the budget to get one. Also, the area in which she lives is a little remote and non-commercial. María knows that with time and the help of her family they can accomplish great things. This is her first loan with MFP and she commits to being very punctual with payments. With the loan that she requests, she hopes to be able to buy more merchandise and thus increase sales.

Translated from Spanish by David Cannon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more merchandise and increase sales

loans.name: Martina De Los A

texts.es: Martina de los Ángeles tiene 58 años. Por lo que no es la primera experiencia que tiene con financiamientos. Su actividad económica es una librería, hace más de 17 años que se dedica a este negocio. Fue por iniciativa propia que inicio este negocio, desde ese momento se ha sacrificado por mantener este medio de vida, ya que a su edad no puede obtener trabajo fácilmente. Ha trabajado con esfuerzo y dedicación durante los años. Sus resultados han sido favorables para que siga con su librería. Solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de cuadernos, lápices, borradores, marcadores, reglas y artículos de oficinas. El sueño de esta Señora es seguir con este negocio.
texts.en:
Martina de los Ángeles is 58 years old. This is not the first experience that she has with funding. Her business is a bookstore and she has been in this business for more than 17 years. It was through her own initiative that this business was started. From that moment, she has sacrificed herself to maintain this means of life, since she can’t obtain work easily at her age. She has worked with effort and dedication throughout the years. Her outcomes have been favorable for her to continue with her bookstore. She is requesting this loan for working capital for the purchase of notebooks, pencils, erasers, markers, rulers and office supplies. The dream of this woman is to continue with this business.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Cristian Karolina

texts.es:
Cristian Karolina tiene 31 años, tiene 2 hijos que están a su cargo. Por lo que no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos. Ella trabaja  todos los días pues su negocio está ubicado en el centro del parque, ya que esta lugar es muy visitado por muchos turistas que gustan de las lindas artesanías. 
Su actividad económica es la venta de artesanía, inicia este negocio por su mama ya que ella era la que tenía el control de su negocio, mas tarde decide independizarse obtener su propio negocio. Con todos los sacrificios realizados, Cristian sigue luchando. Por eso solicita este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima como llaveros, hamacas, camisetas, estuches y lapiceros. Sueña con proporcionar a sus hijos los estudios necesarios.
texts.en:
Cristian Karolina is 31 years old and has 2 children for whom she cares. This is not the first time that she is involved in loans. She works every day and her business is located in the center of the park, since this area is highly visited by many tourists that enjoy the beautiful handicrafts. Her business is selling handicrafts. The business was initiated by her mother since she was the one in control of the business. Later, she decided to become independent and obtain her own business. With all of the sacrifices made, Cristian continues fighting. This is why she is requesting this loan for the purchase of raw material such as key rings, hammocks, shirts, boxes and pens. She dreams of providing her children with the necessary schooling.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: La Nueva Esperanza (Grupo 4) Group

texts.en:
Ysera is the coordinator of her group, La Nueva Esperanza (The New Hope), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in Hato Mayor, an agricultural area in the east of the country, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here as a single mother, in a simple house, with her four children.

Ysera is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her clothing business and to buy new and used clothing for sale. She will use the profits to make improvements to her house and buy school supplies for her children. She hopes for the success of her business and the well-being of her family. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy used and new clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Replenish savings and buy a truck

loans.name: Mujeres Fuertes Y Unidas Group

texts.es:
LA SRA. HERCILIA ANITA, TIENE 49 AÑOS DE EDAD, ESTA CASADA Y TIENE CUATRO HIJOS, QUIENES SON EL MOTOR Y MOTIVO DE SU ESFUERZO Y SACRIFICIO PARA SALIR ADELANTE. ELLA FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO "MUJERES FUERTES Y UNIDAS" FORMADO POR 9 PERSONAS MAS, QUIENES RESIDEN EN LA ZONA DE SAN AGUSTIN EN EL DISTRITO DE COMAS.
LA SRA. HERCILIA ANITA, SE DEDICA TODO EL DÍA A ATENDER SU LIBRERÍA BAZAR, HACE CINCO AÑOS PARA PODER CUIDAR A SUS HIJOS EN CASA, INSTALÓ UNA PEQUEÑA LIBRERÍA LA CUAL HA IDO CRECIENDO POCO A POCO, HASTA HABERLA CONVERTIDO AHORA EN UNA LIBRERÍA BAZAR.
CON SU NEGOCIO, ELLA PUEDE APOYAR A SUS HIJAS EN LOS GASTOS TANTO DE MATRICULA COMO DE MATERIALES PARA SUS ESTUDIOS Y ASÍ BRINDAR UN APORTE IMPORTANTE EN LA MANTENCIÓN DEL HOGAR Y LOGRAR MAS ADELANTE LA PROFESIÓN DE SUS HIJOS.
EL PRESTAMO SOLICITADO LO INVERTIRÁ EN LA COMPRA DE ÚTILES Y ALGUNOS REGALOS PARA SURTIR SU NEGOCIO.
texts.en:
Hercilia Anita is 49, married, and has four children. The children are the driving force and the motivation for her effort and sacrifice in order to get ahead. She is a member of the Mujeres Fuertes y Unidas group. It is comprised of nine other members. They live in the San Agustin area in the Comas district. Hercilia Anita works all day in her bookstore and bazaar. Five years ago she set up a small bookstore in order to be able to take care of her children at home. The store was growing little by little until she converted it into the bookstore and bazaar that it now is. With her business she is able to support her daughters with their expenses, which range from registration fees to school materials. That way she makes an important contribution in maintaining her household. She also enables her children to move ahead toward a profession. She will use the requested loan to buy supplies and some gift items to stock her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies

loans.name: Fabio Guillermo

texts.es: Fabio Guillermo tiene 49 años, su actividad económica es la brindar el servicio de carpintería. Pues esta es la primera experiencia que obtiene con créditos, el se encuentra muy feliz de tener esta oportunidad. Hace más de 30 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que siempre está pendiente de lo que sus 2 hijos necesitan. Inicio por cuenta propia ya que no tenía un trabajo estable y tenía que proporcionarle a su familia lo necesario para sufragar los gastos del hogar. El financiamiento es para la compra de herramientas, madera, clavos, pega, maque entre otras. Sueña con agrandar su taller que es único rubro que tiene.
texts.en:
Fabio Guillermo is 49 years old and he makes a living offering his services as a carpenter. This is his first experience getting a loan and he is very happy to have the opportunity. He has been dedicated to carpentry for more than 30 years and is always aware of the needs of his two children. He took the initiative to get the loan since he did not have a steady job, but needed to cover his family’s household expenses. The funding is for the purchase of tools, wood, nails, glue, lacquer, etcetera. Dreaming of expanding his workshop is the one thing he has.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: María

texts.es: María tiene 28 años de edad ella vive al lado de su esposo y su pequeño hijo Diego de 8 años de edad. El trabajo al que se dedica es la venta de productos de belleza, ya que necesitaba de un trabajo en donde pueda disponer de su tiempo para cuidar su hijo, que aún esta en etapa escolar, de esa manera ha logrado continuar con esta actividad durante 6 años. Ahora sus ventas lo realizan en la tienda de su suegra, haciendo uso de una vitrina en el que coloca sus cosméticos para exhibirlos, logrando así venderlos rápidamente. Otra manera de vender sus productos lo hace cuando deja a crédito sus productos, es le resulta rentable y sobre todo puede brindarle un ingreso extra a la economía familiar. María quiere seguir en este negocio y para ello necesita comprar más mercadería para cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes. Este es su primer crédito con MFP y se compromete a ser muy puntual con todos los pagos de las cuotas. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará mayor cantidad de cosméticos para tenerlos en stock.
texts.en:
María is 28 years old. She lives with her husband and her small son Diego, who is 8. She works selling beauty products, since she needed a job where she could set aside time to take care of her son, who is still in school. She has managed to continue this work for six years. Now she conducts sales in her mother-in-law’s store, making use of a showcase in which she displays her cosmetics, selling them more rapidly. Another way for María to sell products is to sell on credit, which has been profitable for her, and above all, can provide extra income to her family finances. María wants to continue this business, for which she needs to buy more merchandise in order to meet her customers’ demands. This is her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma and she commits to being very timely with all of her payments. With the loan that she is requesting, she will buy large amounts of cosmetics to keep in stock.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha Cerone, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Cosmetics to Sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Buy feed and repair poultry yard

loans.name: Rosa Isabel

texts.es:
Rosa de 39 años, vive en las Orquídeas de Guayaquil, su casa es de caña ella tiene tres hijos de 18, 13 y 9 años, ella tiene un puesto de comida en una escuela de por el sector donde vive. Inicio el negocio pidiéndole al reverendo de la iglesia catolica que le permita vender a los niños de la escuela de la iglesia comida para su hora de receso. 

Comenzó con pocos alimentos vendiéndole a los niños, poco a poco fue incrementando sus víveres, ahora ella trabaja desde las 07h00 hasta las 13h15 de lunes a viernes. Vende hot dog a $ 0.70, bebidas a $ 0.35. Aun le falta implementar algunos alimentos en su negocio, por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo vitrinas, bebidas y víveres. 

En el futuro quiere tener una tienda surtida por su casa.
texts.en:
Rosa is 39 years old and resides in Las Orquídeas in Guayaquil. She lives in a house made of reeds with her three children (ages 18, 13, and 9). Rosa operates a food stall at a school in the district where she lives. She started this business after receiving permission from the priest at the Catholic Church to sell food to the school children during recess.

She began selling a few snacks to the children and gradually expanded her menu. Rosa now works from 7am until 12:15pm, Monday through Friday. She sells hot dogs for $0.70 and soft drinks $0.35. Rosa lacks a few supplies for her business, so she wants to use her loan to buy display cases, soft drinks, and food products. In the future, she hopes to open a well-stocked store in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase display cases, soft drinks, and food products

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: For working capital

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Operational capital

loans.name: Martha Lily

texts.es: Martha Lily tiene 25 años, su actividad económica es la venta de ropa y cosméticos. Hace más de 3 años que se dedica a este negocio. Ella comenzó como vendedora de Avon una compañía de venta de cosméticos por catalogo Por su perseverancia empezó a vender los productos a sus amigas, vecinos y conocidos. Poco a poco fue incrementando su número de clientela pero con esfuerzo y dedicación ella invitaba a sus amigas para que sean vendedoras. Este es el motivo de su financiamiento para la compra de materia prima pintura de uñas, ropa interior, pantalones, sabanas, cremas y otras cosas.
texts.en:
Martha Lily is 25 years old, and for work she sells clothes and cosmetics. She has been doing this business for over three years. She started as a saleswoman for Avon, which is a cosmetic company that sells through catalogs. Through perseverance, she began to sell the products to her friends, neighbors, and acquaintances. Little by little she increased her number of clients, but with hard work and dedication she also invited her friends to become saleswomen as well. This is the motivation behind her request for financing for the purchase of raw material such as nail polish, underwear, pants, sheets, creams and other things.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Daly Flor Maria

texts.es:
Daly Flor María tiene 63 años y 4 hijos en las edades de 25 a 33 años en la urbanización la Playa, muy cerca al mar rodeada de muchos habitantes pescadores; Daly Flor se dedica principalmente a vender carnes frías o embutidos elaborados en carne de res pollo o cerdo y también  vende bebidas refrescantes.  Este es su sexto crédito y quiere hacer una compra en mayor volumen de carnes frías y  tener un stock  de cajas de bebidas refrescantes, que tienen mucha rotación durante los fines de semana y se les termina muy pronto, lo mismo  que a muchos negocio cercanos a los cuales puede vender y convertirlos en nuevos clientes, si ella tiene en existencia.   Su negocio inició hace 9 años, cuando empezó a vender carnes frías por encargo; como a través de este negocio conoció a muchas personas, empezó a  comercializar con ellas prendas de oro por un periodo de dos años, pero cuando el oro se encareció y  ya no le daba la rentabilidad esperada, retornó con mas fuerza a la venta de las carnes frías, desde ese momento se vinculó a un grupo solidario con la Fundación  manejando sus créditos puntualmente.
Daly Flor es una mujer valiosa, ha salido adelante con sus hijos y con su negocio, nunca se ha quedado sin hacer nada porque lo que ha invertido de los créditos a su negocio, le ha generado mayores ingresos para cubrir gastos y  apoyar a su familia.

Su sueño es cambiar el lugar donde se encuentra su residencia porque se ve afectada por las lluvias cuando es época de ellas, también tiene como meta tener un enfriador y poder almacenar mas carnes frías y tener existencia de inventario.
texts.en:
Daly Flor María is 63 years old and has four children between the ages of 25 and 33. She lives in the development of La Playa, which is near the sea where many residents go to fish. Daly Flor primarily sells cold cuts and sausages made of chicken and pork. She also sells soft drinks. This is her sixth loan and she wants to buy a large volume of processed meats and cases of soft drinks. She experiences high turnover on the weekends, so she goes through her inventory very quickly. Like many businesses near her, she needs to attract new customers to continue making sales. Daly Flor started her business nine years ago when she began selling processed meats by taking orders. Through her business, she got to know many people and began selling gold jewelry with them for a period of two years. When the price of gold went up and no longer generated profitable returns, she returned to selling processed meats with greater enthusiasm. From that moment, she joined a solidarity group with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and has managed to repay her loans promptly.

Daly Flor is an esteemed woman who has succeeded in raising her children and running her business. She has never lacked anything because she invested her loans in her business and generated good earnings to cover her expenses and support her family.

Her dream is to move to a different residence because she is affected by heavy rains during the wet season. Another goal she has is to acquire a cooler so that she can store more processed meats and increase her inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase processed meats & cases of soft drinks

loans.name: Daniel Rodrigo

texts.es:
El Sr. Daniel Q. tiene 27 años, es soltero y vive solo. Se encuentra trabajando como empleado en una empresa de seguros durante dos años. Es de profesion Ingeniero Comercial.

Esta empezando un Diplomado por lo que requiere el prestamo para comprar una computadora para poder estudiar y realizar sus trabajos.

Es segundo credito que solicita a nuestra institucion, cancelo sin retrasos. Es un buen cliente.
texts.en:
Mr. Daniel Q. is 27 years old, single and lives alone. He has been working as an employee in an insurance company for two years. He is a commercial engineer. He is starting a certification for which he needs the loan, to buy a computer to be able to study and perform his work. This is the second credit that he has requested and is a good client.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a computer

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es: Elvira de 55 años, con ese negocio que es la venta de granos básicos mantiene a su familia. Pues sus hijas todavía están a su cargo y necesitan de ella. Ahora Elvira trabaja en su tienda desde las 7 de la mañana  a las 6 de la tarde todos los días, Cuando por producto de las lluvias mi casa se derrumbo y quedamos viviendo en casa de una cuñada por un buen rato, hasta que con mi esfuerzo y el de mi esposo logramos construir una casa ahora de bloque concreto.  El negocio ha venido creciendo gracias a Dios.  En ocasiones vende al por mayor sus productos, pues llegan muchos clientes que son de comunidades muy largas. Con el préstamo quiere comprar aceites, azúcar, arroz, frijoles, maíz, concentrado, harina entre otros productos. En un futuro quiere agrandar su tienda.
texts.en:
Elvira, 55 years of age, works selling basic necessities in order to support her family. Her daughters are still in her care and depend on her. Elvira works in her store from 7 am to 6 pm every day. When their house collapsed due to heavy rains, they ended up living with a sister-in-law for some time. With great effort on her and her husband’s part, they managed to build a new house made of concrete blocks. Thanks to God, the business has grown. On occasions, she sells her products at wholesale, and she has customers that come from far away communities. With this loan, she plans to purchase cooking oils, sugar, rice, beans, corn, concentrates, and flour, among other products. In the future, she would like to enlarge her store.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La Sra. Francisca tiene 48 años, es viuda y vive con sus dos hijas las cuales acuden a la universidad D. la ciudad D. Cochabamba, Es ella la que se ocupa D. los gastos D. educacion D. sus hijas.

La Sra. Francisca se dedica a la lecheria desD. hace mas D. 7 años, tiene 8 vacas lecheras, las cuales producen diariamente 115 litros. Entrega toda la produccion D. leche a una empresa que elabora toda clase D. productos lacteos. 

Requiere del prestamo para comprar alimento D. ganado por que es epoca fria y no hay mucho alimento para abastecerse posteriormente.
texts.en:
Francisca is 48 years old, a widow, and lives with her two daughters who attend the university in the city of Cochabamba. She is the one in charge of paying for her daughters’ educational expenses. Francisca has been in the dairy business for more than 7 years. She has 8 milking cows that produce 115 liters per day. She delivers all the milk they produce to an enterprise that makes a variety of dairy products. She needs this loan to buy livestock feed because it is the cold season and there was not a lot of food to stock up with previously.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed for her milking cows.

loans.name: Rosa Olivia

texts.es: Rosa Olivia tiene 44 años. Tiene 6 a su cargo. Ella tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación como cliente ha demostrado que es una persona responsable.  Hace más de 21 años que se dedica a una pulpería, Pese a los diversos problemas familiares y económicos, encontró fuerzas para salir adelante. De esa manera logra con este ingreso cubrir los gastos académicos de cada uno de sus hijos. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo en la compra de granos básicos, que son necesarios para el consumo diario arroz, azúcar, frijoles, refrescos y jugos. En futuro le gustaría ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa Olivia is 44 years old. She has 6 dependents. Ahe has been working with the Foundation for a long time. As a client, she has demonstrated that she is a responsible person. She has been working in a local store for more than 21 years. Despite various family and economic problems, she found the strength to get ahead. In this way she is able, with this income, to cover the schooling costs of each of her children. The financing she is asking for is for working capital for the purchase of basic grains, and things that are necessary for daily consumption such as rice, beans, sodas and juices. In the future, she would like to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Melissa

texts.es: Melissa tiene 22 años, es una joven madre que vive con su pequeña hija en casa de su madre. Hace mas de 6 años se dedica en la venta de productos comestibles en una tienda que tiene y que esta en sociedad con su mama. Paralelo a ello, ambas también se dedican preparando y ofreciendo comida, aprovechando el espacio amplio que tiene su establecimiento, de esa  manera plasman sus grandes dotes culinarias.  Melissa se siente contenta con las actividades que realiza, pues le permite trabajar al lado de su madre y al mismo tiempo velar por su bebe, el cual requiere todavía de sus cuidados. En un futuro desea seguir mejorando e implementando su negocio. Por ahora le pone mucho esfuerzo de su parte para así llegar a cumplir sus tan ansiadas metas a favor de su familia. Es el primer crédito con MFP y se compromete a ser muy puntual con el pago de las cuotas. Con el crédito que solicita quiere implementar su tienda con bebidas y demás alimentos, además desea comprar ingredientes para la preparación de sus platillos.
texts.en:
Melissa is 22 years old, and a young mother who lives with her baby daughter in her mother’s house. For more than 6 years, she has dedicated herself to selling food products from a small store that she runs with her mother. Concurrently, both also work preparing and selling food, taking advantage of the ample amount of space they have in their establishment. In this manner, they can showcase their excellent culinary skills. Melissa is content with the activities she carries out, as they permit her to work alongside her mother while caring for her baby who depends on her. In the future, she wants to continue to improve and expand her business. She puts forth a great effort in order to reach the desired goals she has for the benefit of her family. This is her first loan with MFP, and she commits to be punctual with her installment payments. She will use the funds to stock her store with beverages and more food products and, in addition, she would like to buy ingredients for making her prepared dishes.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies to stock her store, and ingredients for making her prepared foods.

loans.name: Reyna Elisabeth

texts.es: Reyna Elizabeth tiene su actividad económica que es la venta de verdura y frutas. Hace mas de Recuerda que vivía con poco dinero  y convenció a su esposo, para ayudarle a establecer este negocio que es su medio de vida. El dinero que ganaban, con la venta de sus productos, no les alcanzaba. Es por eso que en la actualidad se esfuerzan cada día para mejorar sus ganancias. Siente que todavía hay muchas cosas por realizar en esta vida, es por esta razón que en el futuro tiene pensado establecer su propia pulpería en el mercado. El financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima como naranjas, melones, sandias, mangos, tomates, cebollas y chiltomos.
texts.en:
Reyna Elizabeth’s economic activity is the sale of vegetables and fruits. She recalls that, living with very little income, she convinced her husband to help her establish this business, which is her way of life. The money they made by selling their products was not enough to live on. For this reason, they struggle each and every day to grow their income. She still feels she has much she wants to accomplish in this life. For this reason, her future plans include establishing her own general store at the market. The loan would be used to buy items such as oranges, melons, watermelons, mangos, tomatoes, onions, and sweet peppers.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Socorro De Los Santos

texts.es: Socorro de los Santos tiene la edad de 54 años, tiene 5 hijos y solo 2 de sus hijos están a su cargo. Su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio. Esta no es la primera experiencia que tiene con financiamientos, ya que ella siempre está buscando la forma de aumentar su capital de trabajo. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de materia prima. Desea seguir manteniendo su actividad como lo ha hecho todo el tiempo.
texts.en:
Socorro de los Santos is 54 years old and has 5 children, two of whom are still in her care. Professionally, she sells general commodities. For more than 5 years she has been in this business. This is not the first experience she has had with financing, since she is always looking for a way to increase her working capital. The financing that she requests is for working capital for the purchase of raw materials. She wishes to continue to maintain her business as she has been doing thus far.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Construyendo Un Futuro Mejor Group

texts.es:
LA SRA. JUDITH ANGELA, ES INTEGRANTE DEL GRUPO "CONSTRUYENDO UN FUTURO MEJOR" FORMADO POR 10 PERSONAS QUE VIVEN EN LA ZONA DEL PROGRESO EN EL DISTRITO D. CARABAYLLO. SUS COMPAÑERAS LA ELIGIERON COMO TESORERA D. LA JUNTA DIRECTIVA DEL GRUPO.
LA SRA JUDITH ANGELA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA D. HAMBURGUESAS EN UN CARRITO SANGUCHERO QUE UBICA EN LA PUERTA D. SU DOMICILIO, HACE CINCO AÑOS INCIÓ ÉSTE NEGOCIO, PREPARABA EN SU COCINA Y TENÍA MUY POCA CLIENTELA YA QUE LA PREPARACIÓN DEMORABA, TRABJANDO MUY DURO Y AHORRANDO SUS GANANCIAS PUDO ADQUIRIR UN CARRITO SANGUCHERO Y ÉSTO LE AYUDÓ A HACER CRECER SU NEGOCIO ASÍ COMO AUMENTÓ SU CLIENTELA.
GRACIAS A SU TRABAJO A CONSEGUIDO COMPRAR SUS ARTEFACTOS, PAGAR LA EDUCACIÓN D. SUS HIJOS.
SU PROXIMA META A LOGRAR ES ADQUIRIR OTRA MOTOTAXI PARA PODER ALQUILARLA.
EL PRESTAMO SOLICITADO LO INVERTIRÁ EN LA COMPRA D. SILLAS Y MESAS PARA PODER ATENDER CON MAS COMODIDAD A SUS  CLIENTES PARA LO CUAL ESTÁ AMBIENTANDO UN ESPACIO D. SU CASA. ASIMISMO INVERTIRÁ EN LA COMPRA D. BEBIDAS GESEOSAS.
texts.en:
Judith Angela is a member of the Construyendo Un Futuro Mejor Group. It is comprised of ten people who live in the Carabayllo district. Her colleagues elected her to be the treasurer of the group’s executive board. Judith Angela sells hamburgers from a cart, which is located at the doorway of her house. She started this business five years ago. She maD. the food in her kitchen, and she had few customers because the preparation took too long. By working hard and saving her earnings she was able to get a cart. This helped her to make her business grow and increased her customers. Thanks to her work she has purchased her appliances and paid for her children’s education. Her next goal is to get another “mototaxi” (three wheeled motorized vehicle) to be able to rent it out. She will use the requested loan to buy tables and chairs in order to make her customers more comfortable. She is setting up a space in her house in order to do that. She will also buy soft drinks.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tables and chairs to equip her business and to buy soft drinks

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.es: Rosalina de 54 años, vive con su esposo. Desde hace 15 años, se dedica a su pulpería  y siempre ha tratado que su negocio este bien implementado con los productos comestibles necesarios para satisfacer las necesidades de los clientes. Su tienda es muy concurrida con gran cantidad de clientes, además Rosalina se esfuerza mucho por brindar una buena atención, para que las personas regresen en cualquier momento por el buen trato que les brinda. Le gusta mucho su trabajo porque le da la disponibilidad de tiempo que necesita para realizar las labores de su hogar. Su deseo es tener una pulpería suficiente grande. El financiamiento es para comprar golosinas, pan, jugos, gaseosas, galletas, detergentes y jabón.
texts.en:
Rosalina, 54 years of age, lives with her husband. For more than 15 years, she has dedicated herself to her general store. She has always tried to have a business that is well supplied with the products needed to satisfy customer demand. Her store is very busy with a great number of customers. In addition, Rosalina puts a great effort in to provide a high level of attention so that customers will return often due to the great degree of care she gives them. She enjoys her work very much because it still allows her the time to tend to her home. Her wish is to have a sufficiently large store. The loan is for the purchase of sweets, bread, juices, sodas, cookies, detergents and soap.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es: Cirila tiene 55 años de edad, vive en su casa propia con sus hijos, quienes son ya son adultos e independientes. El trabajo al que se dedica es la venta de productos de belleza, de reconocidas marcas en el mercado, cuya venta lo hace por catálogo. Lleva dos años en esta actividad y ha logrado ganar mucha experiencia, además las ganas de trabajar le ha dado la capacidad y la fortaleza de continuar con este trabajo. Los resultados a su gran esfuerzo es que cuenta con varios clientes fijos que continuamente le hacen algún pedido, por tal motivo se siente contenta con la actividad que hace y por ello quiere seguir aprendiendo y convertirse en líder de la zona en la que vive y así mejorar sus ingresos económicos. Este es su primer crédito con MFP y se compromete a ser muy puntual con todos los pagos de  sus cuotas pendientes. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará mayor cantidad de productos de belleza y así satisfacer los demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Cirila, 55, lives in her own home with her children, who are grown and independent. She sells beauty products of recognized brands in the market, through a catalogue. She has been doing this for two years and has gained much experience; what's more, her earnings have given her the ability and strength to continue with this work. The result of her effort is a loyal, broad customer base who are always ordering products. Because of this, she is happy with her job and wants to continue learning and become a leader in her area, improving her earnings. This is her first loan with MFP and she promises to be very punctual with all of the repayments. With the requested loan, she will buy more beauty products to satisfy demand.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Beauty products

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: Luis Hernández de 73 años. Tiene 3 hijos a su cargo. Luis tiene la actividad económica de mercadería en general. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a esta actividad. Su ubicación es de manera ambulante, es por eso que todos los días se levanta muy temprano para ofrecer sus productos y llevar el pan de cada día a su familia. Con el paso de tiempo ha obtenido experiencia pues ha sido muy importante para la mejora de su actividad. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de materia prima. Su deseo es mantener la estabilidad de económica de su familia.
texts.en:
Luis H. is 73 and has 3 dependent children. He has sold general merchandise for 7 years. He is a walking street merchant, and he gets up very early every day to sell his wares and to provide his family's daily bread. With time, he has gained experience that has been instrumental in the improvement of his work. The requested loan will be used to buy raw materials. His desire is to maintain his family's economic stability.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mauricia Del Socorro

texts.es: Mauricia del Socorro tiene 63 años, hace más de 3 años que inicio con este negocio como es una pulpería, Mauricia ha intentado muchas cosas para mejorar la estabilidad de su familia. Anteriormente se dedicaba a vender ropa, pero tenía muchas dificultades ya que no pasaba mucho tiempo con su familia. Pero como no tenía mucho dinero decidió invertir sus ahorros en víveres y venderlos a los vecinos. Poco a poco fue incrementando su tienda, aunque no cuenta con muchos productos ella sigue trabajando para incrementarlos, vende arroz, azúcar aceite, etc. Con el préstamo quiere comprar víveres como arroz, azúcar y aceites para su tienda. Sueña con terminar de realizarle ciertas reparaciones a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Mauricia del Socorro, 63, started her general store more than 3 years ago. She has tried many things to improve her family's economic stability; she previously sold clothing, but had many difficulties and was not able to spend much time with her family. Because she did not have much money, she decided to invest her savings in supplies and sell them to her neighbours. Little by little her store has been growing, and although she does not have many products she continues working to expand her inventory. She sells rice, sugar, oil, etc. With the requested loan, she wants to buy supplies such as rice, sugar and oils for her store. She dreams of completing certain home repairs.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital: general store

loans.name: Doris

texts.es: Doris tiene 50 años, es una amable mujer que vive con su esposo y sus hijos Kety de 28 años y Wilfredo de 20 años. Juntos viven en su casa propia, hogar que tanto les costo construir. Desde entonces instaló dentro de su domicilio un taller de fabricación de prendas de vestir, y con la ayuda de dos personas se dedican a este trabajo es así que lleva 4 años. Ahora está en la fabricación de carteras, de las cuales están hechas en variados colores y bonitos diseños pues Doris es muy creativa. Disfruta mucho la actividad que hace, aunque esto no significa que sea fácil pues ella debe tener mucha precisión a la hora de la costura pues sino las carteras no tendrían un buen acabado, por ello debe tener una buena visión, esforzándola al máximo. En un futuro desea ampliar su taller y así contratar más personas para aumentar su producción. Este es su décimo crédito con MFP y siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy puntual en todos sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará mayor cantidad de telas cierres, hebillas, entre otros materiales y accesorios que le faciliten el acabado de sus trabajos.
texts.en:
Doris is 50 years old and is a friendly lady who lives with her husband and children, Kety (28), and Wilfredo (20). They live in a home that cost them very much to build and which includes a shop where she manufactures articles of clothing. She has two helpers and has been doing this for four years. She also started making wallets of different colors and nice designs. Doris is very creative. She enjoys doing these things very much, but this does not mean that it is easy work. She must be very precise and put forth a lot of effort when she sews, otherwise the wallets will not be of good quality. Eventually she would like to expand her shop and hire more people in order to increase her production. This will be her tenth loan through MFP and she has always been on time with her payments. She will use the money from this loan to buy fabric, buckles, and other supplies and accessories that she needs for her work.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar materiales y accesorios para confeccionar más carteras.

loans.name: Fatima De La Concepcion

texts.es: Fátima De La Concepción tiene 50 años, pues siempre se ha preocupado por proporcionar a su familia los ingresos para el alimento diario. Su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general y una pulpería. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a esta actividad. Inicio ofreciendo sus productos de manera ambulante y ha luchado fuertemente para obtener estos ingresos. Debido al buen trato con el que atiende a sus clientes su negocio ha ido creciendo y ya cuenta con una clientela fiel. El financiamiento que solicita es para comprar cosméticos, ropa, golosinas, refrescos y jugos. Su deseo es obtener una casa propia.
texts.en:
Fátima is 50 years old and has always been concerned with doing her part to provide for her family. She sells general merchandise and runs a general store. She has been doing this for seven years. She began selling on foot and struggled to make this income. Because of the good service she gave to her customers, her business has grown and she now has loyal customers. She will use the money from this loan to buy cosmetics, clothing, snacks, soft drinks, and juices. Someday she would like to have house of her own.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Marylin De Fatima

texts.es: Marylin De Fátima tiene 41 años, su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Inicio con fondos propios, realizando negocios con una pequeña pulpería, ubicada en su vivienda pues su Mama trabajaba en este negocio, con el paso del tiempo a ella le ha gusto y decidió hacerse cargo pues es una actividad muy rentable, luego decidió iniciar con su propio negocio, ya que necesitaba de un medio de ingreso para mantener a su hijo. El financiamiento es para la compra de ropa interior, juguetes, pantalones, camisas entre otras cosas. Sueña con establecer una tienda en donde ofrezca sus productos.
texts.en:
Marylin is 41 years old and sells general merchandise. She began with a few funds and started a small general store out of her home. Her mother used to run the business, and eventually [Marylin] liked it so she began to run it. It was very profitable and she decided to start her own business, since she needed a source of income with which to support her son. She will use the money from this loan to buy undergarments, toys, pants, and shirts among other things. She hopes to open a store where she can sell her merchandise

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.es:
Nicolas tiene 51 años de edad, es casado y tiene dos hijos que aún estudian, vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Zaña, un distrito conocido a nivel regional por sus constumbres afro – peruanas. Se encuentra ubicado a cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace un año a la compra y venta de arroz. El compra sacos de arroz en los molinos de la ciudad de Chiclayo y luego los ofrece en venta en las bodegas y negocios de la ciudad de Cajamarca. Esta actividad es muy rentable ya que la región Cajamarca, por ser una región ubicada en la sierra del país, no cuenta con este producto de consumo diario al alcance de su mano. Actualmente esta actividad es la única que le brinda ingresos económicos, por lo que se esfuerza al máximo para mantenerla.

Nicolas se ha vuelto conocido en la zona y cada vez son mas las personas que solicitan su producto, por ello desea adquirir mas sacos de arroz para poder aumentar sus ventas. Siguiendo su objetivo ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Nicolas en un padre entregado a su trabajo y a su familia. Sus vecinos le consideran una persona tranquila y responsable. Su mayor anhelo es brindarle a sus hijos una educación de calidad.
texts.en:
Nicolas is 51 years old, married, and has two children who are in school. He and his family live in Zaña, a district known on a regional level for its Afro-Peruvian customs. This area is located 45 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

Nicolas has been buying and selling rice for a year. He purchases sacks of rice from the mills in the city of Chiclayo and then sells them to grocery stores and businesses in the city of Cajamarca. This type of business is very profitable in Cajamarca because it is located in a mountainous area of the country where everyday consumer products are not readily available. At the moment, this business is his only source of income, so Nicolas invests all of his efforts into maintaining it.

Nicolas has become well-known in the area and more people are requesting his product. For this reason, he wants to buy more sacks of rice so that he can increase his sales. To meet this goal, Nicolas is requesting his first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1500 PEN.

Nicolas is a father who is dedicated to his work and his family. His neighbors consider him to be a peaceful and responsible person. His greatest wish is to provide his children with a quality education.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sacks of rice

loans.name: Pedro Pablo

texts.es: Pedro Pablo tiene 40 años. el se dedicaba a la ganadería, negocio que fue heredado por mis padres pero cuando me case tuve la necesidad de un negocio que generara un ingreso mensual. ya que tenía una casa y una familia que me exigía gastos mensuales, pero como él tiene mucho tiempo de vivir aquí se dio cuenta que no existía ninguna panadería y con el dinero de la venta de algunos animales pudo iniciar operaciones en su negocio de panadería desde hace 10 años.  Negocio que responde a las necesidades de mi familia. Es por este motivo que realiza este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima como mantequilla, queso, harina, huevo entre otras cosas.
texts.en:
Pedro is 40 years old. He used to raise livestock, a business that he inherited from his parents, but when he married, he needed to be able to generate a monthly income; having a home and a family generates monthly expenses. Since he had lived in the same neighborhood for a long time, he realized that there were no bakeries in the area, so with money he got from the sale of some of his animals, be started his bakery ten years ago. He is asking for this loan in order to buy supplies and ingredients, such as butter, cheese, flour, and eggs, among other things.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ngaet

texts.en: Mrs. Ngaet S. is 40 years-old and lives in Anlong Ta Sek Leu village in Kandal province. She is married to Mr. Vanna Son. She is a duck breeder who earns some money to support her family. However, she has a problem because her ducks are too small to sell.  In order to improve her breeding ducks, Mrs. Ngaet S. is asking for a loan to buy duck food. Her husband is a farmer who owns more than two-hectares of land to grow crops to sell to support his family. From these activities, they support four children.  Three of the children attend the local public school and the other is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy duck food.

loans.name: Khhim

texts.en: Mrs. Khhim I. lives I. Kamnab village I. Kandal province. She was born I. 1960. She is married with four children, two of whom are seamstresses I. a garment factory, another is a construction worker and the other is studying I. local public school. She and her husband, Mr. Soem Sok, are farmers who own one-hectare of land to grow crops to sell to support their family. Right now their problem is that their field is growing on time but they do not have enough money to support it. I. order, to improve production, Mrs. Khhim I. is seeking a loan to grow winter melons this year.

loans.use: To grow winter melons.

loans.name: Khai

texts.en: Mrs. Khai K. is married to Mr. Seak Orem. They have four children. Two children are seamstresses in a garment factory and the others are attending the local public school. This family lives in Lvea Sa Kraom village in Kandal province. She is a vegetable seller in her local village who earns some money to support her family. Since her business is going well she wants to expand it. In order to improve her business, Mrs. Khai K. is seeking a loan to buy more vegetables to resell. Her husband is a vice villager and he is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy more vegetabless to resell.

loans.name: Savuth

texts.en: Mrs. Savuth S., 41, lives in Sambuor village, Kandal province, taking care of the household, while her husband, Mr. Saren Sor, works as a laborer and a cow breeder.  Mr. Sor's income is essential for supporting the family's financial needs, in particular, the needs of the couple's three children, two of whom are seamstresses in a garment factory, while the third one earns money selling desserts. Although all of Mrs. S.'s family members work hard, even their combined income is still very low. To improve the family's living conditions, Mrs. S. is therefore applying for a loan to be able to buy a cow for breeding.

loans.use: Purchase of a cow for breeding

loans.name: Clorinda

texts.es:
Clorinda es una madre de familia de 50 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus tres hijos en el caserío Granja Sasape del distrito de Túcume, un distrito agrícola de la provincia de Lambayeque conocido a nivel regional por sus vestigios arqueológicos que se han convertido en un atractivo turístico. La zona se encuentra ubicada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace seis años a la venta de comida. Ella tiene un puesto que actualmente funciona frente al local de una institución bastante frecuentada por los pobladores del caserío y de zonas aledañas. Allí ella ofrece a sus clientes diversos platos de comida y algunas bebidas. El negocio goza de mucha acogida ya que ella brinda siempre un trato amable y prepara sus alimentos con muy buena sazón.

Su negocio ha experimentado un crecimiento durante los ultimos meses y ella está pensando en comprar mesas y sillas para atender con mayor comodidad a sus clientes, para lograr su objetivo ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.

Clorinda es una mujer trabajadora y responsable, en la zona donde vive es bastante conocida y estimada por los pobladores del lugar. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria y tener un local propio donde pueda instalar un restaurante.
texts.en:
Clorinda is a 50 year old mother who lives with her husband and three children in the village of Granja Sasape in Túcame, a farming district in Lambayeque Province, which is known regionally for its archaeological sites that have become tourist attractions. This area is located an hour away from the city of Chiclayo.

Clorinda has been selling food for six years. She operates a vending stand that has become a local institution since she is frequented by residents of the village and from the surrounding areas. Clorinda offers her customers a variety of dishes and drinks. Her business has earned much publicity because she always provides friendly service and prepares food with great flavor.

Since her business has experienced growth in the past few months, she wants to buy tables and chairs so that her customers will be more comfortable. To meet this objective, she is requesting her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 500 PEN.

Clorinda is a hardworking and responsible woman. In the area where she lives, she is recognized and respected by the local residents. Her greatest wish is to continue growing as a businesswoman and have her own location where she can open a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tables & chairs to improve the infrastructure of her food business

loans.name: Rong

texts.en:
Mr. Rong S., 39, lives in Ta Skor village, Kandal province, where he works as a fisherman, while his wife, Mrs. Salim Young, earns income selling cakes. Through these activities, the couple is supporting five children, three of whom are attending a local public school, while the others are too young to work or study.
At the moment, Mr. S. is facing difficulties in his work, as the equipment he uses for fishing is too old and worn out. Mr. S. is therefore asking for a loan to be able to buy a new fishing net and fix his old fishing board. The rest of the loan will be used by his wife to buy more cakes for resale.

loans.use: Purchase of a fishing net and repair of a fishing board

loans.name: Pao

texts.en:
Mrs. Pao P., 42, lives in Prasat village, Kandal province, where she earns income selling various groceries. Mrs. P. has three children, two of whom are attending a local public school, while the youngest one is only two years old. Mrs. P.'s husband, Mr. Ra Ren, is a farmer who grows crops on a small piece of land that he owns.
Mrs. P.'s grocery sales business is going well, and she would like to expand and improve it even further. She is therefore applying for a loan to buy more groceries for resale.

loans.use: Purchase of groceries for resale

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sok Khum

texts.en: Mrs. Sok Khum L., who is 48 years old, lives in Krang Thmey village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Ye Chea, are farmers. They own more than one-hectare of land on which they grow crops to sell to support their famiL.. Their problem is that their field's soil has become infertile. To improve production, Mrs. Sok Khum L. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer, while the rest of the loan will be used to hire some farm laborers. Through their farming they support five children, two of whom are helping their parents with the farming, while the others are attending the local public school. Mrs. Sok Khum L. and Mr. Ye Chea are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Wilfred

texts.en:
Wilfred M. is from the village of Brgy. Vista Alegre, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 55 years old, married and has 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, Wilfred owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Wilfred has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP when he sells one of his raised pigs.

In 2010, Wilfred joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Wilfred is requesting a new loan of 30000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Wilfred from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Pha

texts.en: Mr. Pha N. lives in Lvea Sar Kandal village in Kandal province. He is a 40 year old farmer who owns more than one-hectare of land. Mr. Pha N. supports his family by cultivating rice to sell on the land and also has a side job as a motorbike taxi driver. He has a problem because his field is far away from the irrigation system. So to improve production, Mr. Pha N. is applying for a loan to dig a well. His wife, Mrs. Yoeurn Chak, is a housewife who makes delicious food for her family. They have six children, three of whom are attending the local public school, while the others are too small to work or study. He and his wife are in the photo.

loans.use: To dig a well.

To make a living, Rita owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. loans.name: Adiyasuren

texts.en:
Adiyasuren S., 54, lives with his wife and three children in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a 'ger', a Mongolian nomadic housing tent. They have been living together in their current home for 20 years.

Adiyasuren operates a wooden products manufacturing business in his town. He started his business in 1998 by making a small amount of furniture out of his yard. Initially, he received a 300,000 MNT loan from our bank to purchase a saw for his business (in 2001). 

Adiyasuren is a hard-working man and has gained much experience in his craft over the past 12 years. The whole family has supported the business and they have built a stable operation with a loyal customer base. Adiyasuren is known for his good personality and he has many ambitions for the future. His dream is to one day build his own workshop. In addition, he wants to enjoy watching  his grandchild grow up and enroll in university. Adiyasuren is requesting a 1,600,000 MNT loan to purchase timber for his business manufacturing wooden products.

loans.use: to purchase timber for his wooden products business

loans.name: Ganhuyag

texts.en:
A. is 30 years old and lives in a 'ger', a Mongolian nomadic housing tent, in Arhangai province, Mongolia. She has been living in her current home for 10 years. 

A. has operated a consumer goods business in her town since 2009. She started her business by borrowing 200,000 MNT from a friend. Since then, A. has quickly grown her business and today her working capital exceeds 800,000 MNT. She is an industrious person and focused on the future. A. has been working hard for a better life. She is requesting a 600,000 MNT loan to purchase consumer goods from Narantuul, the biggest market in Ulaanbaatar, with her brother's help.

loans.use: to purchase consumer goods for resale

loans.name: Lon

texts.en: Mrs. Lon L., who lives in Ta Skor village in Kandal province, was born in 1968. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she cultivates rice to sell in order to support her family living. However, she faces a problem, her field is far away from irrigation system and she does not have enough money to access water. So to improve production, Mrs. Lon L. is asking for a loan to buy a water machine and hose. She is widow and has one child who works as a babysitter.

loans.use: To buy a water machine and hose.

loans.name: Badamtseren

texts.en:
Badamtseren, 53, is a widow who lives with her two children in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in a 'ger', a Mongolian nomadic housing tent. They have been living together in their current home for ten years. 

Currently, Badamtseren operates a mobile meat and food products retail business in her town. She purchases her products from wholesale shops in Mongolia and Ereen, a Chinese border town. Badamtseren has been in this business for many years and has gained much experience. In addition, she has a small plot of land where she plants vegetables for family use and sells any surplus each fall at the market. 

Badamtseren is an enthusiastic person who has been working hard to provide a better life for her two children. Her main business goal is to own her own workplace and expand her business operation. Badamtseren is requesting a 350,000 MNT loan to purchase vegetable seeds for her business.

loans.use: to purchase vegetable seeds

loans.name: Barshagul

texts.en:
Barshagul, is 42 years old and lives with her husband and five children in Bayn-Ulgii province in western Mongolia. She and her family live together in a 'ger', a traditional nomadic tent home. Barshagul has operated a meat trading business in her town since 1990 and has steadily expanded her business over the years. She purchases meat wholesale from herders in the surrounding countryside and resells to her customers. People in her province typically  prepare meat for the winter during October and November. One family will consume up to one ox and ten sheep through the course of the winter which will last them through March. 

As meat stocks are currently low, Barshagul's business is starting to pick up for the summer. Barshagul is a very hard-working person and has many plans for the future. She says, “I am working hard to support my children's future.” She is requesting a 300,000 MNT loan to purchase meat at wholesale prices.

loans.use: to purchase meat at wholesale prices

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en: Mrs. Sokha T. is married to Mr. Samorn Srey. This couple has four children, two of whom are seamstresses in a garment factory, while the others are attending a local public school. This family lives in Srae Ampil village in Kandal province. Mrs. Sokha T. and her husband are farmers who own one-hectare of land to grow crops to sell to support their family. Their problem is that their field has infertile soil and there are a lot of insects. So to improve production, Mrs. Sokha T. is seeking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides. Her husband is shown in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.name: Bat-Erdene

texts.en:
Bat-Erdene is 38 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters in an apartment in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia.  His older daughter, Bolortuya, attends a local primary school and his younger hasn't yet reached school age. 

Bat-Erdene operates a construction materials retailing business in his town together with his wife. He has been operating his business since 2004 and has steadily expanded his business over the past six years. Bat-Erdene operates his business out of a shipping container which he owns at a rented area at the local market. He purchases his products two to three times a month from Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

Bat-Erdene has a good business mind and attributes his success to his good communication skills. He has many plans for the future and says, “My wife's and my dream is to one day to have our own real shop.” Bat-Erdene is requesting a  2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase a variety of construction materials to sell at his business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of construction materials

loans.name: Elaine

texts.en:
Elaine G. is from the village of Barangay Lawig, Lamut, Ifugao. She is 26 years old. Elaine is married and has 2 infant children. To make a living, Elaine raises pigs for breeding. Elaine has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4500 PHP a month in these activities.

In 2009, Elaine joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Elaine is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This will be the first loan taken out by Elaine from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support the immediate members of her family.

loans.name: Sao

Mr. Sao S. is a bread seller, earning enough money to support his family. But his problem is that he does not have a motorbike for transporting his breads for resale. He wants to expand his business. To improve this business, Mr. Sao S. is seeking a loan to buy a new motorbike. His wife is shown in the photo with him.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Bayarsaihan

texts.en:

Currently, his working capital is 1,900,000 MNT. 

With his profits, he purchased a truck for his business which he uses to transport his products. Bayarsaihan is an enthusiastic person and has great business skills. He has many plans for the future and hopes purchase a Russian jeep which offers a more comfortable ride through on the rough country roads. He is requesting a 2,300,000 MNT loan to purchase flour and a 'ger' cover for his mobile products trading business.

loans.name: Channy

texts.en:

The couple supports five children.  Two of their children are seamstresses in a garment factory, while the others attend a local public school. It is time to pay school fees for their three children, but the family does not have enough money.  To improve their children's education, Mrs. Channy K. is asking for a loan to pay these school fees.

loans.name: Sophorn

Her husband, Mr. Hun Thoeurn Yos, is a farmer who owns a plot of land where he grows crops to sell. Unfortunately, her husband’s field is infertile and it has a lot of insects. To improve production, Mrs. Sophorn P. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide. She is a mother of four children, one of whom is a seamstress in garment factory, while the others are enrolled in local public school.  Her husband is pictured in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Phally

texts.en: Mr. Phally Y. was born in 1964. Now he lives in Preak Svay village in Kandal province. He is a fisherman who earns some money to support his family by selling fish. His wife, Mrs. Channa Koev (pictured with him), is a farmer who rents a small plot of land to grow crops to sell to support the family. Unfortunately, Mrs. Channa Koev's field has a lot of insects and it is far away from an irrigation system. To improve production, Mr. Phally Y. is asking for a loan to buy pesticide and a water machine. He is a father of five children, two of whom are seamstresses in garment factory.

loans.use: To buy pesticide and a water machine

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia S. is from the village of Brgy. Tuao North, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 48 years old, married, and has three infant-aged children. To make a living, Amelia owns and operates a specialized store selling a variety of vegetables, such as onions, in the local community. Amelia has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 4,700 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2007, Amelia joined Kiva partner, ASKI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

With the proceeds from these activities, they support four children, three of whom are seamstresses in a garment factory, while the other is attending a local public school. Her husband is shown in the photo with her.

loans.name: Chimgee

texts.en:
Chimgee G. is 40 years old and lives with her two children in Baynhongor province, Mongolia. Her younger son, Bathuleg, attends a local primary school, and her older son, age 19, has a mental disorder for which she receives monthly assistance from the government.  Her husband passed away in 2008 after suffering a serious illness. 

Chimgee operates a second-hand products business in her town. Previously, she worked as a technologist and later as a sales manager for a bakery between 2002 and 2009. However, her first business was as a meat trader from 1999 to 2002. 

Chimgee is a very hard-working person who must rely on her business to support her family. She strives to provide a better life for her two sons. In the future, she would like to have her own workplace and expand her business. Her dream is to one day open her own bakery as she has a significant experience in this field. Chimgee is requesting a 280,000 MNT loan to purchase second-hand products.

loans.use: to purchase second-hand apparel

loans.name: Yan

texts.en: Mrs. Yan P. is 66 years old. She lives in Ta Reab Doun Sa village in Kandal province. She is a widow, and she has a child who is a seamstress in a garment factory. Her position as a fruit seller at her local market allows her to earn some money to support her family. Since her business is going well she wants to expand it. So to improve her business, Mrs. Yan P. is applying for a loan to buy more fruit to resell. She hopes that she can earn some money to increase her business with this loan.

loans.use: To buy more fruit to resell.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Mrs. Sok O., who lives in Ta Chou village in Kandal province, was born in 1964. She is a fisher seller at her local market and earns some money to support her family's costs of living. Now she can sell the fish at a high enough income that she would like to expand her business, but she does not have enough money to achieve this goal. So to improve her business, Mrs. Sok O. is asking for a loan to buy more fish to resell. She is widow and has three children, all attending a local public school.

loans.use: To buy more fish to resell.

loans.name: Heang

texts.en: Mr. Heang M. is living in Preaek Bak village in Kandal province. He is 64 years old. He is a farmer who hires a piece of land to grow crops to sell to support his family. Now his problem is that his field is far away from an irrigation system. So to improve production, Mr. Heang M. is asking for a loan to buy a water machine. With the rest of the loan, he wants to buy rice seed and fertilizer. He is a widower with two children. His children are mirror cutters.

loans.use: To buy a water machine, rice seed and fertilizer.

She is widow with two children, one of whom is a seamstress in a garment factory, while the other is attending a local public school.

loans.name: Lagrimas

texts.en:
Lagrimas A. is from Barangay Santa Cruz, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 47 years old. Lagrimas is married and has 6 young children. To make a living, Lagrimas owns & operates a business preparing and selling halo-halo (a kind of snack/dessert made of different fruits, milk and ice) to the local community. Lagrimas has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lagrimas joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Lagrimas has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase the raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Lagrimas is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Lagrimas from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Mrs. Sophal Pang Village Bank Group

texts.en: In Prey Totueng village in Kandal province this group of eight people make up a village bank loan. All the members have selected Mrs. Sophal P. as village bank president. They will each use a portion of the loan, for different purpose,s to improve their businesses in the future. Mrs. Sophal P. is a housewife who cooks delicious food for her family. Her husband, Mr. Sokorn Yem, is a construction laborer. This couple supports four children, three of whom are attending a local public school. One of the children is a laborer, and one is learning to drive a car. Now she has a problem because she does not have enough money to support her children’s learning. So to improve this condition, Mrs. Sophal P. is asking for a loan to pay for for her child’s driving school fee.

loans.use: To pay for her child’s driving school fee.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna R., from the village of Brgy. Sta. Cruz, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya, is a married 36-year-old mother of five young children. To make a living, for over six years she has been raising pigs for breeding, earning approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Myrna joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 7000 PHP from ASKI that was used to purchase breeding livestock, she is now requesting a new loan, her third, of 7000 PHP to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Myrna plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Heoung's Group

texts.en: This group loan has two people who live in Krang Roluos village in Kandal province. Mrs. Heoung B. is a group leader, selected by another member who will use a portion of the loan for different purposes. She and her husband, Mr. Oroeurng OrU., are farmers who own a small piece of land to cultivate rice for their own use, and they are cow breeders too. Through this activity, they support two children who are seamstresses in a garment factory. Although all of the members of this family try to work hard, they earn very little income. So to improve the financial conditions of their family, Mrs. Heoung B. is asking for a loan to buy a cow for breeding.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Thol's Group

She and her husband, Mr, Chhen Soy, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice to support their family. Now they have a problem because their field is infertile. So to improve productiO., Mrs. Thol O. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and rice seed. According to this activity, they support two children, one of whom is a seamstress in garment factory, while the other is attending a local public school.

loans.name: Mrs. Sopheap Uk Village Bank Group

texts.en: In Krapeu Ha village in Kandal province, eight people make up a village bank loan. They will use a portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their businesses in the future. Mrs. Sopheap U. is the village bank president, as selected by the other members. She is 50 years old. She is a laborer, earning a small income to support her family. She is a widow with a child who is employed in a private company. Now she has a problem because her home is too old. So, to improve this condition, Mrs. Sopheap U. is asking for a loan to fix her old house.

loans.use: To fix her old house.
