Nancy’s dreams are to expand her shop and that her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy paint.

loans.name: Martha Irene

texts.es:
Martha vive en Barrio de Quinuapata, es casada y tiene 4 hijos, Martha tiene una tienda muy surtida en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, carnes, gas, leña, también prepara chupetes, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de sus hijos, su préstamo será invertido en la compra de arroz, aceite, leche, leña.
Martha sueña con que sus hijos sean profesionales y ampliara su negocio e incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Martha lives in the Quinuapata neighborhood; she’s married and has 4 children. Martha has a well-stocked store in her house where she sells assorted groceries like vegetables, meats, gas, and firewood. She also prepares ‘chupetes’ (fruit flavored frozen treats) with help from her children. She will use the loan to buy rice, cooking oil, milk and firewood Martha’s dreams are that her children become professionals, that she can expand her store and increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, cooking oil, milk and firewood.

loans.name: Janet Del Pilar

texts.es:
Janet es una madre de familia de 25 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a su menor hijo en el caserío La Colorada, una zona rural del distrito de Mórrope, distrito caracterizado por tener a la mayor parte de su población concentrada en zonas rurales que distan mucho una de la otra, pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicado a una hora y quince minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace tres años a la crianza y venta de animales, ella cría animales menores y aves de corral en un ambiente ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio, cuando estos ya ha alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que visitan la zona regularmente. Este negocio es una fuente importante de ingresos, con ellos ayuda a su esposo a sostener la economía de su familia.

Janet desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas animales y alimento balanceado para ampliar su negocio de crianza y venta, ella espera aumentar sus ingresos y de esta manera seguir ayudando a su familia a salir adelante, para lograr su meta ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1700 nuevos soles.

Janet es una joven entregada a las labores de su hogar, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para realizar mejoras en su vivienda y darle a sus hijos una buena educación. En la zona donde vive, sus vecinos la consideran una persona activa y bastante responsable.
texts.en:
Janet, 25, lives with her husband and son in the La Colorada settlement, a rural area of Mórrope district, a district that’s known for having most of its inhabitants in rural areas that are isolated from one another. It is part of Lambayeque province and is located an hour and fifteen minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For the last three years she has been raising small farm animals and barnyard fowl in her back yard. When they reach a proper level of development she puts them up for sale to merchants that visit the area regularly. This business is an important source of income with which she helps her husband support the family. Janet wants to expand her business buying more animals and nutritionally balanced feed for them. She hopes to increase her income this way and continue to help her family get ahead. To reach this goal, she has asked Edpyme Alternativa for her first, 1700 new sol, loan. Janet is a young woman who is dedicated to her household chores. Her greatest wish is to continue growing as a businesswoman in order to make improvements to her home and provide her children with a good education. She is considered to be an active and quite responsible person by her neighbors.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy small farm animals and nutritionally balanced feed for them.

loans.name: Olga Amelia

texts.es:
Olga es socia del Banco Comunal Suni que significa Abundante en quechua
Olga es separada y tiene 4 hijos, Olga se dedica a la agricultura de papa en terrenos que alquila en diferentes distritos, además compra papa de los productores, luego de acopiar todo el producto los comercializa en el mercado de abastos al por mayor a los comerciantes, Olga también tiene un puesto en el mercado Señor de Arequipa en donde vende también papa. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra de papa. Sus sueños son que sus hijos sean profesionales, tener capital propio para ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Olga is a member of the Suni, which means Abundant in Quechua, communal bank; she’s separated and has 4 children. Olga grows potatoes on farmlands that she leases in various districts; she also buys potatoes from other farmers. Once she gathers all the potatoes together she sells them to merchants in the wholesale produce market. She also has a small stand in the Señor de Arequipa market where she sells potatoes. She will use the loan to buy potatoes. Olga’s dreams are that her children become professionals and to have enough capital to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy potatoes.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos, vive en casa alquilada, Isabel tiene un puesto en la feria de platos típicos de la ciudad en donde vende comida típica los días sábados y domingos, y se ubica de manera ambulatoria en una calle aledaña al complejo deportivo Mariscal Caceres, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su esposo.
Isabel es socia del Banco Comunal Suni que significa Abundante en quechua y necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que invertirá en la compra de arroz, azúcar, papa.
Isabel sueña con comprar un terreno para construir su casa e implementar un negocio estable.
texts.en:
Isabel lives with her life partner and their two children in a rented house. Isabel has a food stand in the city’s traditional foods market where she sells traditional dishes on Saturdays and Sundays. She also sets up an itinerant sales stand on a street adjacent to the Mariscal Cáceres sports complex, an activity she undertakes with her husband’s help. Isabel is a member of the Suni, which means Abundant in Quechua, communal bank and needs a 1500 sol loan to buy rice, sugar and potatoes. Isabel’s dream is to buy a lot on which to build her house and to set up a stable business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar and potatoes.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
Felicitas es soltera y vive con su mama, Felicitas vive en la comunidad de Chacco y se dedica a la siembra de verduras en sus terrenos, además compra los mismos productos de otros productores para luego de acopiar llevar a los mercados de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho. Su préstamo será invertido para comprar verduras y abono.
Felicitas desea tener mas extensión de terrenos para producir mas verduras y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Felicitas is single and lives with her mother. Felicitas lives in Chacco and works planting vegetables in her lands. Also, she buys the same products from other producers to then bring in bulk to the food markets in the city of Ayacucho. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of vegetables and fertilizer.

Felicitas wants to extend her land more to produce more vegetables and improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and fertilizer

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.es:
Genoveva pertenece al Banco Comunal Suni que significa Abundante en quechua, Genoveva es viuda y tiene 2 hijos, vende leña en su casa, producto que adquiere de los productores que le traen a su casa. Además Genoveva vende golosinas, bebidas de manera ambulatoria en la puerta del Colegio Abraham Valdelomar. Su préstamo será para la compra de leña, galletas, caramelos.
Genoveva sueña con tener una tienda y sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Genoveva belongs to the Communal Bank Suni, which means abundance in quechua. Genoveva is a widow and has two children. She sells firewood in her home, a product that she gets from the producers who bring it to her house. Also, Genoveva sells candies and drinks to passer-bys in the entrance of Colegio Abraham Valdelomar. Her loan is to buy firewood, cookies and candies.

Genoveva dreams to own a shop and that her children finish their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase firewood, cookies and candies

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes tiene 57 años D. edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo y a una hija ya casada en el caserío Santa Isabel, una zona rural del distrito D. Mórrope, conocido a nivel regional por tener a L. mayor parte D. su población concentrada en zonas rurales que distan mucho una D. L. otra. Pertenece a L. provincia D. Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicada a una hora y media D. L. ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica desD. hace mas D. diez años a L. crianza D. ganado vacuno, ovino y porcino en un terreno cercano a su vivienda, elL. cría estos animales y los venD. a los negociantes que siempre visitan L. zona donD. vive. El negocio es una fuente importante D. ingresos para su familia, ya que su esposo es agricultor y los ingresos que percibe no son permanentes.

Mercedes desea mejorar L. calidad D. alimentación D. sus animales para percibir mayores ingresos y así mejorar su calidad D. vida, por este motivo ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1500 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en L. compra D. alimento balanceado.

Mercedes es una mujer hogareña y que siempre trabaja para lograr el bienestar D. su familia, elL. apoya en lo que pueD. a su esposo en las labores agrícolas. Los vecinos D. L. zona L. consideran una mujer honesta y responsable.
texts.en:
Mercedes is 57 years old, is married, and lives with her husband and their married daughter in the small community of Santa Isabel, a rural area in the district of Mórrope. This district is regionally known for having most of its population concentrated in rural areas that are relatively isolated from one another. The area where Mercedes lives is part of Lambayeque province and is located an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo. For more than 10 years Mercedes has maD. a living raising cattle, sheep, and pigs on land close to her home. She raises these animals and then sells them to the businessmen who visit the area where she lives. The business is an important source of income for her family, since her husband is a farmer and does not earn a constant income. Mercedes wants to improve the quality of her animals’ diet so that she can earn a larger income and thus improve her quality of life. That is why she has requested a loan for the first time from Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa. This loan, for 1500 Peruvian soles, will be invested in purchasing balanced animal feed. Mercedes is a woman who loves her home and always works to improve her family’s wellbeing. She helps her husband with his farm work in whatever way she can. Mercedes’ neighbors in the area consider her to be an honest and responsible woman.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing balanced animal feed and improving the raising of her livestock

loans.name: Las Orquideas De Jilo Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama las Orquídeas de Jilo y esta ubicado en el  Estado de México, en México. El grupo esta conformado por diez integrantes y es la primera vez que solicitan crédito a credicomun.

La señora Ángela Zúñiga Hernández es integrante de este grupo, tiene 31 años de edad, estudió hasta el sexto año de primaria, es casada y tiene en total 2 hijos varones de 8 y 7 años, ella se dedica a ala crianza y engorda de borregos que inicio hace 8 años con un solo borrego, el cual engordo y lo vendió, y con el dinero compro una borrega para la reproducción de la especie, y así fue como ha ido forjando su patrimonio. Solicita el crédito para la compra de alimento y forrajes para alimentar a sus borregos y en cuanto estén listos venderlos para nuevamente adquirir otros e invertir en el crecimiento de las crías de sus borregas, ella también tiene otros animales como pollos, guajolotes y conejos. Al momento de solicitar el crédito se siente animada ya que dice ha tenido otros créditos que le han beneficiado notoriamente pues con las ganancias ha podido invertir en la siembra para la alimentación de sus animales y el consumo de su hogar, en útiles escolares y prendas de vestir para sus hijos y esta convencida que mientras la actividad siga funcionando ella seguirá trabajando, para así brindar una mayor oportunidad de estudio a sus hijos y mejorar su calidad de vida, ponerle loza a su casa  y los servicios de agua y luz ya que hasta el momento no cuenta con ellos.

También espera a un plazo no muy largo ampliar la cría y engorda de conejos pues considera que este negocio también genera buenas ganancias y tal ves mas adelante pueda conseguir pedidos más grandes para entregarlos en canal o vivos y que el negocio crezca generando para ella y su familia mejores ingresos.

Areli C. Díaz es la presidenta del grupo tiene 22 años y estudio hasta el 3° de secundaria es ama de casa y aun no tiene hijos ella se dedica a la engorda de puercos que inicio hace 1 año y solicita el préstamo para comprar el alimento de estos animales.

Las demás integrantes del grupo son:
-	Paulina T. D.  (Venta de dulces)
-	Ma. Luisa M. G. (Venta de dulces)
-	Dolores S. V.        (Cría y engorda de guajolotes y pollos)
-	Celia Hernández G.  (Venta de mercería)
-	Lourdes G. F.   (Venta de Colchas)
-	Graciela D. A.    (Venta de verduras)
-	Yanet T. D.    (Venta de servilletas)
-	Teresa Zúñiga V.       (Cría de pollos)
texts.en:
This group is called the Orchids of Jilo and is located in the State of Mexico, in Mexico. The group is comprised of 10 members and it is the first time that they have requested a loan from credicomun. Mrs. Ángela Zúñiga Hernández is a member of this group; she is 31 years old and studied until the 6th grade. She is married and has two sons- ages 8 and 7. She breeds and fattens sheep, which began 8 years ago with a single lamb, which fattened and sold. With this money, she bought a lamb for the reproduction of the species and that’s how their business began. She is requesting the loan to buy food and fodder to feed their sheep. When she sells them, she will be able to acquire others and again invest in the growth of the lamb from the sheep. Also, she has other animals such as chickens, turkeys, and rabbits. She is excited about her loan application, because she has had other loans, which have benefited her greatly. She has been able to invest in growing food for her animals and to consume in her home. She has also been able to invest in school supplies and clothing for her children. She is convinced that while business thrives she will continue working to provide greater opportunity for her childrens’ education. She will also be able to improve their quality of life by bringing in goods for the home and services such as water and electricity since she does not currently have them. Also, she hopes in time to increase the size of her rabbit-raising business because she believes that this business also generates good profits and maybe later can get larger orders, butchered or alive. Then, the business will grow generating the best income possible for her and her family. Areli C. Díaz is the president of the group. She is 22 years old and studied until her third year of high school. She is a housewife with no children. She started fattening pigs a year ago and is requesting a loan to buy the food and fodder for these animals. The other members of the group include: -Paulina T. D. (Candy Sale)  -Ma. Luisa M. G. (Candy Sale)  -Dolores S. V. (Breeding and fattening of turkeys and chickens)  -Celia Hernández G. (Sale of Haberdashery)  -Lourdes G. F. (Quilt Sale)  -Graciela D. A. (Vegetable Sale)  -Yanet T. D. (Napkin Sale)  -Teresa Zúñiga V. (Breeding Chickens)

Translated from Spanish by Dina Bach, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase food and fodder to feed their sheep

loans.name: Alberto

texts.en: Fifty-year-old Alberto O. is from the town of Banga. He is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Alberto raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice and corn for sale. Alberto has been engaged in his business for over 18 years already. Alberto joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alberto is requesting a new loan of 6,000 Philippine pesos, which will be used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure, and other farm inputs. This will be the first loan taken out by Alberto from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his business. About CEVI Community Economic Ventures, Inc., (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but also offers savings, insurance and training programs, which are provided through regular cluster group meetings. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, such as manure, and other farm inputs

loans.name: Arnel

texts.en:
Arnel S. is from the town of Banga. He is 40 years old. Arnel is married and has five school-aged children. Arnel owns and operates a corn farm. He also owns a small sari-sari store (general store) located at his house. Arnel has been engaged in his business for over nine years now.

Arnel joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to do business. Arnel has successfully repaid his first loan from CEVI. Arnel is requesting a new loan of 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
59-year-old Cecilia J. is from the town of Banga. She is married and has five adult children. Cecilia owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Cecilia also owns a farm where she plants and harvests rice. She has been engaged in her business for over 13 years already.

In 2009, Cecilia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Cecilia has successfully repaid her first loan from CEVI. Cecilia is now requesting her second loan, for 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP), which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve it.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Cleofe

texts.en: Cleofe E. is from the town of Banga. She is 39 years old. Cleofe is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Cleofe raises crops. The main source of income for her business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Cleofe has been engaged in her business for over 12 years. Cleofe joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cleofe has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Cleofe is requesting a new loan of 8,000 Philippine pesos, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the third loan taken out by Cleofe from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business. About CEVI Community Economic Ventures, Inc., (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but also offers savings, insurance and training programs, which are provided through regular cluster group meetings. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha C. is from the town of Banga. She is 64 years old. Editha is married and has 6 adult-aged children. To make a living, Editha owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice and corn for sale. Editha has been engaged in her business for over 15 years already.

Editha joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Editha is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure and other farm inputs. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Editha from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure and other farm inputs

loans.name: Elvin

texts.en: Elvin Y. is from the town of Banga. He is 37 years old, married and has 2 infant children. To make a living, Elvin owns and operates a business planting and harvesting corn for sale. Elvin has been engaged in his business for over 19 years already. Elvin joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elvin has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Elvin is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Elvin from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his business and supplement his family's income. About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly in recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but, additionally, savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
45 year old Elvira D. is from the town of Banga. She is married and has a 27 year old child. To make a living, Elvira owns and operates a business raising laying chickens to produce and sell eggs.  Elvira has been engaged in her business for over 28 years now.

Elvira joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elvira has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Elvira is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Elvira from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Estela

texts.en: Estela E., 51 years old, is from the town of Banga. She is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Estela owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. She also raises some chickens. Estela has been engaged in her business for over 22 years now. In 2009, Estela joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Estela has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Estela is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Estela from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly in recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but, additionally, savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
41-year-old Gina H. is from the town of Banga. She is married and has two adult children.

Gina owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty years already.

Gina joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI.
