loans.name: Serigne Mansour Group

texts.fr:
Le Groupe de solidarité SERIGNE MANSOUR est crée depuis 3 ans et composé de neuf femmes toutes issus du même quartier. Elles sont d’âge différents, de 30 à 50 ans mais la plus part a la trentaine, sont mariées  et mères d’au moins de 3 enfants. Le groupe a été constitué par affinité et par des liens amicaux. 
Leur activité principale est le petit commerce de produits cosmétiques, de légumes, de bois de chauffe, de charbon de bois et  de poisson frais. Celles qui font la vente de poisson s’approvisionnent à Kayar, un village de pêcheurs situé environs à 50 kilomètres de leur quartier. Elles achètent au bord pirogue en grande quantité pour revendre au marché centre de Thiès, leur région d’origine, et font également du porte à porte pour une livraison à leur clientèle fixe. 
Madame Soda D., s’est adonnée spécialement à cette activité de vente de poissons, une activité qu’elle mène depuis quatre années ce qui lui permis de capitaliser une bonne expérience dans ce domaine. L’objet de son crédit est d’augmenter son niveau d’autofinancement et l’objectif est de renforcer son épargne et de contribuer au payement des factures d’électricité et aux dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The SERIGNE MANSOUR solidarity group was created three years ago and is made up of nine women from the same neighbourhood. They are different ages, between 30 and 50, but for the most part in their thirties, married and mothers of at least three children. The group got together through affinities and friendships. The group’s main activities are the retail commerce of beauty products, vegetables, firewood, charcoal and fresh fish. Those who sell fish get their supplies in Kayar, a fishing village located about 50 kilometers from their borough. They buy large quantities directly from boat side, to be resold at the central market of Thiès, their home town. They also go door-to-door, home-delivering to their regular customers. Mrs. Soda D. has been running her fish-selling business for four years now, which brought her quite some experience in this domain. She wants to use her loan to increase her level of self-financing and contribute to paying power bills and daily family expenses.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen the group's self-financing capacity

loans.name: Amadou Baïlo

texts.fr: Amadou Baïlo D. est une femme de 25 ans, elle est mariée dans son village d'origine et mère de 04 enfants en charge. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 4 ans et a eu 8 bonnes expériences avec le crédit pour avoir toujours remboursé sans aucune difficulté. C'est un membre très fidèle et régulière aux réunion de Banc Villageois. Madame Amadou Baïlo D. est d'ethnie Peulh réputée être de grands éleveurs et son crédit actuel lui servira à acheter deux bœufs, des produits vétos et de l'aliment de bétail pour engraisser les sujets pendant au moins 5 mois avant de les revendre dans les marchés hebdomadaires de son quartier.
texts.en:
Amadou Baïlo D. is 25 years old, married in her home town and the mother of four children. She has been a member of the local “Banc Villageois” loan group for four years and had eight successful experiences with credit loans, all reimbursed without any difficulties. She is a very steady member and regularly attends the “Banc Villageois” meetings. Mrs. Amadou Baïlo D. belongs to the Peulh ethnic group, which has a solid reputation as cattle ranchers. Her current loan will be used to buy two oxen, veterinarian products and cattle feed, so that she can fatten them for five months before they are resold at the weekly market fairs in her area.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy two oxen for fattening

loans.name: Issatou

texts.fr: Issatou D. est une femme de 38 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants en charge. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis le 22 janvier 2003, elle a capitalisé une expérience de 7 ans avec le crédit et n'a jamais eu de difficulté de remboursement, au contraire elle vient souvent au secours aux membres confrontés à certains problème de cet ordre. Elle est restauratrice et son nouveau prêt lui permettra de renforcer son activité en achetant plus de provisions afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. Son objectif est de prendre en charge ses enfants pour la couverture alimentaire, sanitaire et scolaire.
texts.en:
Issatou D. is a 38 years old woman, she is married and a mother responsible for five children. She has been a member of a “Banc Villageois” since January 22, 2003. She has accumulated seven years of experience in borrowing and has never had difficulties to reimburse, in fact it is the opposite she often comes to the help of members who face that kind of problems. She does catering and her new loan will enable her to strengthen her activity by buying more supplies in order to better meet her customers’ demand. Her goal is to take care of her children financially with regards to food, health care and schooling.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To continue her catering activity

loans.name: Juan  Alberto

texts.es:
Juan Alberto es un muy buen hombre que trajo el campo a la ciudad desde hace 13 años, cuando se dedicaba a la agricultura y a la ganadería  y  se fuè a la Ciudad de Cartagena durante un año  y luego, buscando una forma de vida similar a  su naturaleza, se estabilizó en San Jacinto, la tierra delas Hamacas elaboradas  a mano en Colombia, donde fuè empleado por el Municipio y aprendió la apicultura,o arte de manejar colonias de abejas para producir la mas pura miel; este es el oficio en el que ahora trabaja y del cual reunió un capital para que su cónyuge se dedicara a lo que a ella más le gusta “la venta de mercancías como ropa para niños, damas e íntima y el servicio de telefonía celular, siendo estos negocios los  que les han generado los ingresos,  especialmente para el sostenimiento de sus  3 hijos en las edades de 12, 14 y 17 años. 
Para Juan Alberto este es su tercer crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización que lo  ha apoyado en el aumento de sus ingresos y en la ampliación de su apiaro  o colmenar que hoy es mucho más grande y produce cada año más ingresos, por la pureza de la miel que de allí se extrae. Su crédito lo invertirá en la compra de marcos para la colmena y también surtirá el negocio de mercancía que le montó a su cónyuge aprovechando lo concurrida que es la zona donde vive.
Como es un hombre de negocios, sabe que debe trabajar y ahorrar para que sus hijos puedan estudiar en la universidad, este es su gran sueño y en la actualidad su máximo desafío, lo mismo que el de tener la obligación de ser cada día más productivo y próspero.
texts.en:
Juan Alberto is a very good man who brought the country to the city 13 years ago. He worked in agriculture and stockbreeding and went to the City of Cartagena for a year. Then looking for a similar way of life, he settled in San Jacinto, the land of the hand-made Hammocks in Colombia. He was hired by the Town and learned apiculture or the art of handling bee colonies to produce the purest honey. This is the job he has now. He raised capital this way so that his wife could work at what she likes most, merchandise sales like children’s clothing, women’s clothing and underwear, and a cell phone service. These are the businesses that have generated the income, especially to support their 3 children who are 12, 14 and 17 years old. This is Juan Alberto’s third loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. The organization has supported him in increasing his income and in expanding his beehives. Today it is a lot bigger and produces more income each year due to the purity of the honey. He will invest the loan to buy beehive frames and to stock the merchandise sales business he started for his wife, taking advantage of the busy area they live in. Since he is a business man, he knows that he must work and save so that his children can study at the university. This is his big dream and currently his maximum challenge, as well as his obligation to be more productive and prosperous every day.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase beehive frames to produce honey; also to stock the merchandise business he started for his wife, taking advantage of the busy area they live in.

loans.name: Amy

texts.fr: Amy B. est âgée de 36 ans, elle est mariée et mères de 04 enfants en charge. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 2004 et a eu 13 fois de suite reçu de crédit et a toujours remboursé sans difficultés. Elle est détentrice d'une boutique où elle vend divers produits tels du riz, du lait, des détergents, du café etc.. Son nouveau crédit lui permettra de renforcer sa boutique en marchandises afin de prétendre à des bénéfices plus important qui lui permettront de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille, par exemple par rapport à la nourriture, la santé et l'habillement des enfants.
texts.en:
Amy B. is a 36 year-old married mother of four. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois credit association since 2004, having received 13 loans, all of which she has successfully repaid. She is a shopkeeper and sells various products, such as rice, milk, detergents and coffee etc. Her new loan will enable her to increase her range of stock, and generate higher profits which will enable her to improve her family's living conditions, for example with food, healthcare and her children's clothes.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing her shop's range of stock

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis C., reside en El Municipio del El Transito Departamento de San Miguel, tiene 48 años  vive con su esposa y dos hijos de 26 y 23 años respectivamente, se dedica a la agricultura (Siembra de Maíz).
Don Luis se dedica a la agricultura hace 35 años, y de la edad de 11 años su padre le enseño el trabajo, actualmente el se ha dedicado a sembrar maíz  con ayuda de uno sus hijos, el se encuentra con la dificultad de no tener el dinero para la compra de semilla y abono, por los que se ha visto  con la necesidad de solicitar este préstamo, compraría ( semilla de maíz, Abono) y así  sembrar para obtener una cosecha venderla, lograr ganancias para cancelar su deuda, ayudar a su familia para solventar las necesidades de alimentación y otras.
Luis es una persona luchadora, acostumbrada a trabajar y sacrificarse por su familia, sus aspiraciones son ampliar más el cultivo y obtener una buena cosecha comercializarla y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Luis C. lives in the municipality of El Transito in the department of San Miguel. He is 48 years old and lives with his wife and two children, aged 26 and 23. Luis works in agriculture. He has been in this work for 35 years. His father taught him at the age of 11. Today, Luis grows corn with the help of one of his sons. At this time, he cannot afford to buy seeds and fertilizer, so he has applied for this loan. After harvesting and selling his crop, he will be able to pay off the loan, as well as provide necessities for his family. Luis is a fighter, accustomed to working and sacrificing for his family. His goals are to increase his production and obtain a good harvest. This will improve the quality of life for his family.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy seed and fertilizer for corn crop

loans.name: Ruby Esther

texts.es:
Las artesanías elaboradas en el Municipio de San Jacinto,  son parte integral de la cultura de esta región, por eso al llegar desde el municipio de Ovejas, desde hace algo más de 7 años, Ruby C. Rodríguez y su hermana, ambas en la fotografía, se dedicaron a vender entre otros productos, las más hermosas hamacas y mochilas elaboradas por manos que dominan  este arte en la región; Ellas   viajan a otros municipios como Ovejas y poblaciones del departamento de Sucre, al norte del país en la región Caribe Colombiana, para comercializar  estos productos y esta es justamente su mayor clientela.
Ruby ha recibido 3 créditos de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo  y también ha sido financiada directamente por su hermano,  para poder impulsar su actividad, pues  como buena mujer cabeza de familia, responsable de su hija de 14 años, sueña con verla convertida en una profesional próspera y para eso la educa y trabaja persistentemente, este es su principal reto pues nunca ha contado con la ayuda idónea de su padre, sino con el buen corazón de sus hermanos. Como ahora busca un nuevo capital para invertirlo en su  negocio e impulsar el aumento de sus ingresos, solicita un financiamiento a la Fundación para comprar hilazas y elaborar artesanías y también comprar ropa interior para dama que venderá  junto con su hermana y que han sido solicitadas a estas dos mujeres.
texts.en:
The handicrafts made in the municipality of San Jacinto are an integral part of the culture of this region. For this reason, we arrive at the municipality of Ovejas, where for more than 7 years Ruby C. Rodríguez and her sister, both in the photograph, have been selling, among other products, the most beautiful hammocks and bags. These are hand-made in a manner typical of the art in the region. They travel to other towns like Ovejas and population centers in the Sucre department in the northern part of the country in the Caribe Colombiana region, in order to sell these products, as this is where their main clientele is located. Ruby has received 3 loans from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, and also has gotten financing directly from her brother, in order to propel her business forward. As a good mother and head of family, responsible for her 14 year-old daughter, she dreams of seeing her daughter become a prosperous professional. For this reason she works persistently to keep her in school; this is her main challenge, as she has never counted on the help of the father, but she has depended on the good heart of her brothers. She now looks for new capital to invest in her business to increase her earnings. She requests a loan from the Fundación to buy yarn to make handicrafts and also to buy women's undergarments that she will sell with her sister, which are products that are in demand from these two women.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy yarn to make handicrafts, and also to buy women's undergarments to expand her business

loans.name: Fatou Kissima

texts.fr: Fatou Kissima a 35 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de DINGUIRAYE, dont elle est la secrétaire depuis l'inauguration de celui-ci le 22 janvier 2003. Elle est très dynamique et défends à chaque fois les intérêts de l'assemblée du groupe pour sa bonne marche. Elle a une boutique au cœur du marché hebdomadaire de son village et son nouveau crédit lui permettra de mieux l'approvisionner en marchandises tel du riz, du son de mil, de l'aliment de bétail et d'autres denrées alimentaires. Son objectif est de soutenir son mari pour la prise en charge de leur progéniture.
texts.en:
Fatou Kissima is a 35 year-old married mother of 4. She has been secretary of the Dinguiraye credit association since its inauguration on the 22nd of January 2003. She is very dynamic and works in the group's best interests so that it functions well. She has a shop at the heart of her village's weekly market, and this new loan will enable her to more effectively source her goods, such as rice, millet, animal feed and other food items. Her aim is to assist her husband in looking after their children.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Developing and promoting her shop

loans.name: Dora Esther

texts.es:
Cuando Dora terminó el bachillerato,    hace un poco más de 7 años, se dio cuenta no podía seguir estudiando por falta de recursos económicos, ella comenzó a buscar la forma de lograr el sueño de tener una carrera profesional, que le ayudara a conseguir un buen trabajo  y ayudar económicamente a su familia. Así fuè como aprendió el tema de la belleza y se dedicó a ofrecer servicios de peinados, cortes, alicer, pedicure y manicure y con la ayuda de una vecina que le dejaba ropa para damas a consignación, de una fácil manera de pagarle, se inició como negociante y al año siguiente se independizó porque le fuè muy bien, adquirió un capital propio y empezó a viajar a Barranquilla de donde trajo ropa femenina; posteriormente su hoy cónyuge se agregó al negocio y aumentó su experiencia microempresarial, asì mismo diversificó su oferta vendiendo una nueva línea de productos por catálogos como perfumes y cosméticos, sin dejar de ofrecer servicios de belleza pues tiene todos los implementos y el saber para hacerlo y es más la clientela que es la misma que solicita todos los servicios . En la actualidad los ingresos familiares provienen de sus negocios  y logró terminar estudios superiores y aspira a terminar otra carrera, afín con su trabajo. . En la actualidad solicita su primer crédito a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para invertirlo en insumos para belleza y surtirse con bolsos calzado y ropa para damas principalmente.
Más adelante sueña con tener su casa propia, planeando la estabilidad los hijos que piensa tener,  también  quisiera ayudar a mucha gente a conseguir  su propio capital, como lo hicieron con ella, pues vive en un sector combinado entre familias y grandes empresas es decir en una de las zonas industriales de Cartagena y eso potencializa su actividad.
texts.en:
When Dora finished secondary school, a little more than 7 years ago, she realized that she couldn’t continue studying because of lack of financial resources. She began to look for a way to realize her dream of having a professional career that would enable her to get a good job and help her family financially. That was when she learned about being a beautician and she began doing haircuts, hair styling, hair relaxing, pedicures, and manicures. With the help of a neighbor who left her women’s clothes on consignment on easy terms, she began to sell, and the next year went out on her own because she was doing well. She put in some of her own capital and began to travel to Barranquilla where she brought women’s clothing. Later on her current partner joined the business and increased her micro entrepreneurial experience. They diversified what she was selling with a new line of products in catalogs such as perfumes and cosmetics. She didn’t stop working as a beautician since she had all the equipment and knowledge in the field and also her customers were asking for her services. Currently the family income comes from her businesses and she succeeded in completing her high school and wants to finish more studies related to her work. She is now asking for her first loan from the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation to buy supplies for her beauty business and merchandise, mainly purses, shoes and women’s clothing. In the future she dreams of having her own house, planning for the stability of the children she wants to have, and she also wants to help people get their own capital, as she was. She lives in an area that is a mixture of families and big businesses. That is an industrial zone of Cartagena and this helps her business.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Beauty supplies and principally merchandise such as purses, shoes, and women's clothing

loans.name: Bokk Jom Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BOKK JOM est l'un des huit groupes de solidarité du banc Villageois de DIAMAGUENE, il est créé le 22 octobre 2007 et composé de 9 membres toutes issus du même quartier que porte le nom du Banc Villageois. Elles sont 8 femmes sur la photo, la neuvième madame Astou T. s'est absentée pour des raisons de rendez-vous médical. Elles ont formé leur groupe de solidarité par affinité, elles sont en moyenne âgées d'une quarantaine d'années, toutes mariées et mères d'au moins de 3 enfants.

Leur activité est principalement la vente d'effets vestimentaire, des produits halieutiques et de produits cosmétiques. Elles vont dans les grandes villes comme à la capital Dakar pour acheter la marchandise et revenir vendre dans leur quartier et environs. Il y en a qui se sont fixées dans leur magasin au marché, c'est le cas de Rama D. et Nogoye T., mais les autres font du porte à porte. 

la Présidente Madame Mingué D., à l'extrême droit de la photo, en boubou blanc et pagne en fleurette est âgée de 53 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants et tutrice d'un grand garçon de 18 ans en classe de terminale. Elle est vendeuse de produits halieutiques et cuit des beignets qu'elle vend devant chez elle et en faisant du parte à porte. son objectif est de soutenir son neveu en classe de terminale pour l'obtention du Bac. 

Le groupe, en sus des épargnes mensuels qui verse procède à des remboursements réguliers d'une façon solidaire.
texts.en:
The Bokk Jom group is one of the eight solidarity groups in the “Banc Villageois” of Diamaguene. The group was created on October 22, 2007 and is made up of 9 members all from the same neighborhood after which the group is named. There are eight women on the photo, the ninth one, Mrs. Astou T., was absent because of a medical appointment. They formed the solidarity group by affinity. They are on average around 40 years old, all married and mother of at least three children. Their main activity is the retail of clothing, seafood products, and cosmetic products. They go to large towns, like the capital Dakar, to buy their merchandise and come back to sell them in their neighborhood and in the vicinity. Some of them have a permanent shop at the market, as is the case for Rama D. and Nogoye T., but the others are selling door-to door. The President, Mrs. Mingué D. at the far right of the photo wearing a white “boubou” and a flower printed “pagne”, is 53 years old. She is married and the mother of two children. She is also the guardian of an 18-year-old boy, a high school senior. She sells seafood products and cooks donuts that she sells from her home and door-to-door. Her goal is to provide for her nephew a high school senior, so he can pass the “baccalaureate”.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To strengthen the commercial and economic activities of the group

loans.name: Sumaq Sunqu Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Sumaq Sunqu que significa Corazon Bonito en quechua, esta integrada por socias son D. la comunidad D. Villa Florida, Distrito D. Iguain, Provincia D. Huanta, la comunidad esta ubicada a 20 minutos D. la ciudad D. Huanta, las actividades principales son la ganadería y agricultura.
Jennifer es secretaria del banco Comunal, es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos que están estudiando, Jennifer compra animales menores D. las diferentes comunidades y los venD. en la feria D. la ciudad D. Huanta, actividad que aprendió D. su tío y hasta ahora cuenta con la ayuda D. su tío. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra D. gallinas y ovejas que luego engordara en su casa para obtener mayores utilidades.
Los sueños D. Jennifer son educar a sus hijos y mejorar su casita para ellos.
texts.en:
The communal bank Sumaq Sunqu, which means "Big Heart" in Quechua (language of the indigenous people of Peru), is composed of members from the Villa Florida community, Iguain district, Huanta province. The community is located 20 minutes from the city of Huanta. The principal activities are ranching and farming. Jennifer is secretary of the communal bank. She is a single mother and has two children in school. She buys young animals from different communities and sells them in the Huanta city market. Her uncle taught her how to buy and sell animals, and she still depends on his help. Her loan will be invested in hens and sheep, which she will fatten at home in order to obtain better profits when they are sold. Jennifer's dreams are to educate her children and to improve her small house for them.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of hens and sheep

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen De Qaqamarca Group

texts.es:
Las socias del Banco Comunal Virgen del Carmen D. Qaqamarca son D. la comunidad D. Qaqamarca, Distrito D. Ocros, Provincia D. Huamanga, las actividades principales D. la comunidad son la agricultura y ganadería.
Dolores es secretaria del Banco Comunal, Dolores es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos 2 varones y 1 mujer, tiene una panadería en su casa, actividad que aprendió D. su familia que también se dedica al mismo negocio, sus productos los venD. en su comunidad con la ayuda D. sus hijos, los insumos los adquiere en la ciudad D. Ayacucho y también en su comunidad. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra D. harina para elaborar mas panes.
Los sueños D. Dolores son brindar una buena educación D. sus hijos, implementar su panadería con maquinarias modernas y comprar un carro para repartir sus productos a otras comunidades.
texts.en:
The members of the communal bank Virgen del Carmen D. Qaqamarca are from the Qaqamarca community, Ocros district, Huamanga province. The principal activities of the community are ranching and farming. Dolores is secretary of the communal bank. She is a single mother and has 3 children, 2 boys and a girl. She learned baking from her family and has a bakery in her house. She sells her products in the community with the help of her children. Supplies are acquired in the city of Ayacucho and also in her community. Her loan will be invested in flour, which will be used to bake more bread. Dolores's dreams are to give a good education to her children, to install modern machinery in her bakery, and to buy a car to distribute her products to other communities.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of flour

loans.name: Virgen De Fatima Group

texts.es:
Las socias del Banco Comunal Virgen D. Fátima son D. la Comunidad D. La Merced, Provincia Churcampa, Departamento D. Huancavelica, las actividades principales D. la comunidad son la agricultura, ganadería y la preparación D. chancaca D. cabuya.
Delia es socia hace mucho tiempo, es casada, tiene 4 hijos carones, Delia se dedica a la Compra  y venta D. animales menores, fruta, verdura y chancaca. Su negocio empezó con el  trueque, compraba D. Huanta   frutas y verduras; los  llevaba a las  diferentes comunidades D.  churcampa para  canjearlos  con  cereales pero era  demasiado el peso D. los  cereales que tenia  que  cargar a la carretera  D. las diferentes casas. Hoy  en  día  solo los  venD.  en las  zonas donD. hay facilidad con la  movilidad. Sus productos los compra en Huanta y  los  venD.  en las ferias y en Churcampa. Compra animales menores D. churcampa y los  venD.  en Huanta. Actividad que realiza con la ayuda D. su esposo e hijos. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra D. animales menores que los engordara para luego comercializarlos.
Delia desea que  sus  hijos sean profesionales, y  ahorrar hasta noviembre para pagar el viaje D. estudios  D. su segundo hijo que  esta  en la promoción del colegio.
texts.en:
The members of the Virgen D. Fátima Communal Bank are from the La Merced community in the Churcampa province, Huancavelica department. The main activities in the community are agriculture, livestock, and preparing "chancaca D. cabuya" (brown sugarloaf maD. from sugarcane and agave). Delia has been a member for a long time. She is married and has four sons. Delia buys and sells small animals, fruit, vegetables and chancaca. Her business started as an exchange. She bought fruits and vegetables from Huanta. She took them to the different communities in Churcampa in order to traD. them for basic grains. But, the grains were too heavy to take to different houses on the road. Now she only sells them in areas that she can get to easily. She buys her products in Huanta and sells them at the fairs in Churcampa. She buys small animals in Churcampa and sells them in Huanta. She does this with help from her husband and sons. The loan will be used to buy small animals to fatten and then sell. Delia wishes for her sons to become professionals. She also wishes to save until November in order to pay for the class trip for her second son. He is graduating from high school.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy small animals

loans.name: Paulino

texts.es:
El señor Paulino L. P., tienen la edad de 42 años,  es casado y su esposa labora como docente aportando con sus ingresos a la economía domestica, tiene 3 hijos adolecentes, un menor, y los otros dos mayorcitos que actualmente estudian, la familia habita en el Barrio Piedra Quemada de la ciudad de Ticuantepe, el tipo de habitantes que ahí moran, son de recursos escasos, que en su mayoría se dedican a la agricultura y de familias grandes, que no les permiten mejorar su economía por la necesidad de suplir las necesidades básicas de consumo.

Ellos cultivan yuca y tiene 31 años  de experiencia en este rubro, solicita un préstamo para la adquisición de abono y fertilizantes y mejorara el mantenimiento agronómico y fitosanitario a los sembrados de yuca, con esta inversión mejoraran la producción de yuca y así los volúmenes de venta, que aporten a  la economía que ha futuro les brindara el capital necesario para proyectos del negocio, personales o familiares.
texts.en:
42-year old Señor Paulino L. P. is married; his wife is a teacher and contributes to household finances. He has three teenage children, and the two older ones are students. The family lives in the neighbourhood of Piedra Quemada in the town of Ticuantepe. The majority of the people who live there are poor, work in agriculture, and have large families so they lack the money to improve their financial situation. Everything they earn is spent on basic necessities. Paulino and his family grow yucca and have 31 years of experience in this line of work. He is asking for a loan to buy manure and fertilizer to improve the health of his yucca crop. Such an investment would help increase production and lead to more sales and greater income. This money would give Paulino the capital necessary for business, personal, and family projects.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer for his yucca fields

loans.name: Lester Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Lester Antonio U. B., es casado y su esposa realiza los trabajos del hogar, con sus tres hijos menores de edad, habitan en el Barrio Lomas de Guadalupe,  él labora como chofer de rutas urbanas, ellos son una familia muy humilde que con su propio esfuerzo edificaron el humilde hogar donde ahora residen.

Es para su vivienda que solicita un préstamo para la construcción de un levantamiento de tapia, que le resolverá el problema de división de territorio que posee actualmente con sus vecinos aledaños, con el crédito realizara las compras de  materiales de construcción, agradecerá el apoyo que se le pudiese dar ya que con esta inversión les podrá ofrecer una mayor seguridad para todos sus pequeños hijos y la tranquilidad como padres de criar a sus hijos en un ambiente más seguro y cómodo.
texts.en:
Señor Lester Antonio U. B. is married; his wife looks after the household. They and their three children live in the neighbourhood of Lomas de Guadalupe. Lester works as a driver in the town. The family is a simple one, but with hard work they have built a humble home where they now live. It is for this house that Lester is asking for a loan. He wishes to repair a wall and solve the problem with his neighbours over division of land. With the money he plans to buy construction material. He is grateful for the loan and the greater security that the wall will provide to his young family. It will bring him and his wife as parents peace of mind to know that they will be raising their children in a safer, more comfortable environment.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy construction material

loans.name: Margelia Del Rosario

texts.es:
La señora Margelia del Rosario S. B., tiene la edad de 27 años es madre soltera de dos hijos menores de edad que dependen totalmente de ella, habita en el barrio Buena Vista y se dedica a la agricultura de la yuca desde hace más de 15 años, fueron sus padres que la iniciaron a laborar en este rubro y tener un sustento para su familia.

Ha pensado comprar unas vaquillas, para agrandar el hato ganadero que actualmente posee,  uno de los problemas que se les ha presentado a lo largo de su trabajo en la agricultura ha sido el robo de la producción y ha pensado en construir una caseta para vigilar las áreas de cultivo, por el momento solicita un préstamo para la compra de matariles agrícolas, que brinden un mantenimiento óptimo a las cosechas y una producción superior a las pasadas que aumenten los volúmenes de ventas y los ingresos mensuales, para la obtención del capital necesario para los futuros proyectos que tiene en mente que aportan al porvenir de sus dos hijos. Ella es una mujer que ha luchado sola y habita gracias a su esfuerzo de una forma digna pero desea mejorar aun mas sus condiciones de habitad para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Margelia del Rosario S. B. is 27 years old. She is a single mother to 2 small children who totally depend on her. Margelia lives in the suburb of Buena Vista and has worked in agriculture growing yuca for over 15 years. Her parents started her working in this area, and she now has a way of sustaining her family. She has been thinking about buying some cows to increase the livestock she has. One of the problems that she has been presented with has been the robbery of the crops. Margelia has been thinking about constructing a small hut to keep an eye on her cultivation, but for the moment is seeking a loan to purchase agricultural materials. This will allow her to optimally maintain the crops and give her a superior sowing season, increasing the volume of sales and her monthly earnings, thereby obtaining the necessary capital for future projects she has in mind that will contribute to her children's prospects. Margelia is a woman who has worked hard by herself, and thanks to her efforts has a dignified life, but she still wants to improve her living conditions more for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials such as fertilisers, pesticides, and vegetative items

loans.name: Norma Estela

texts.es:
La señora Norma Estela L. es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos bajo su responsabilidad. 
Solicita un préstamo para pagar la inscripción de la escuela de sus niños, pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario y desea que sus hijos estén bien preparados para que tengan un buen futuro.
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte de las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio de venta de tortas y tacos en su casa.
texts.en:
Norma Estela L. is a single mother with two children.
She is requesting a loan to pay for her children’s school registration fees. She does not have sufficient funds, but wants her children to be well-educated so that they can have a good future.
She plans to repay her loan with some of the profits generated from her home business selling sandwiches and tacos.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: School fees

loans.name: Bokk Jom-Medina Sorar Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BOKK-JOM de Médina Sorar est créé, il y a six mois en même temps que l'inauguration du Banc Villageois "MEDINA SORAR" en 2009. il est composé de 11 membres issus tous du même quartier que porte le nom du Banc Villageois. C'est un groupe très soudé et solidaire, qui tien régulièrement des rencontres de concertation et d'échange pour la bonne marche de leurs activités de commerce. C'est un groupe homogène, elles sont toutes mariées et mère d'au moins de 3 enfants. Se sont des femmes très dégourdies en matière de commerce, elles diversifient leurs activités commerciales, certaines vendent de l'encens, d'autres des produits halieutiques ou cosmétiques et/ou tissus.

la présidente, Madame Fatou T., à l'extrême droit de la photo, en tenue tapissés de carreaux rouges, gris et jaunes est âgée de 45 ans. C'est une femme très dynamique, qui cultive un bon esprit de solidarité et d'entraide dans le groupe. Elle est pleine de rigueur et de volonté et ne ménage pas d'effort pour la bonne marche du groupe et la réussite de ses entreprises. Elle fait du commerce d'effets vestimentaires et de produits cosmétiques. Elle s'approvisionne à Dakar, la capitale du Sénégal pour revendre à crédit dans son quartier. Les recouvrements elle les fait périodiquement à la fin de chaque mois. Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge familiale par la nourriture et la scolarité des enfants.

Bien vrai que le groupe n'a que 6 mois d'existence dans le système de l'institution de micro finance CAURIE-MF, mais ses membres menaient des activités de petit depuis plus de 5 ans. Ce qui leur a doté d'une bonne expérience en matière commerciale et à fait que leur premier remboursement a été effectué sans faille, et leur niveau d'épargne assez bon.
texts.en:
The BOKK-JOM group of Médina Sorar was created six months ago in 2009, at the same time the MEDINA SORAR « Banc Villageois » loan group was inaugurated. The group consists of 11 members, all from the same neighbourhood, from which the Banc Villageois took its name. It is a very closely knit and supportive group, which regularly holds consultation and exchange meetings to ensure the good functioning of their businesses. It is a homogeneous group of married women, mothers of at least three children. They are very resourceful in commercial matters, diversifying their activities: some sell incense, others seafood products, beauty products, or clothing fabrics. The president, Mrs Fatou T., seen at the far right in the picture, wearing a red, gray and yellow square-patterned ensemble, is 45 years old. She is a very dynamic woman, who nurtures a spirit of solidarity and mutual aid within the group. She is quite strict and strong-willed and doesn’t spare any efforts to maintain the good functioning of the group and the success of their business activities. She retails clothing apparel and beauty products. She gets her supplies from Dakar, the capital of Senegal, for resale on credit in her neighbourhood. She recovers her loan payments at the end of each month. Her objective is to support her husband with their children’s nourishment and education. Although the group only existed six months within the CAURIE-MF MFI, their members had prior experience with credit loans over the past five years. This has given them a solid commercial sense, ensuring that their first loan was reimbursed without problems, and also sustaining a good level of savings.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen the group's self-financing capacity

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
Vender productos de aseo para el hogar  fuè  la idea de negocio, que entre un compañero de estudio y Cecilia C.  Arévalo pusieron en marcha, para cumplir  con el sueño de tener una microempresa; pero poco tiempo duró la sociedad y esta última tuvo que seguir sola en la que  hoy se denomina  “Distribuidora Cecy”. Al comienzo no fuè fácil, pero como la perseverancia de Cecilia no tiene límites, decidió seguir y hoy después de un año y medio se sostiene en el mercado con recursos propios y  con alguna financiación que en su momento resultó valiosa, porque determinó  su continuidad y ahora sueña con cambiarse a un sector más comercial para favorecer sus ventas e ingresos. 
Este es el primer crédito  por valor de $700.000 COP que Cecilia tiene con  la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con él pretende comprar productos por galones como jabón limpiador desengrasantes y cera auto brillante. Su desafío más grande fue cuando finalizó la sociedad y le costó mucho trabajo cumplir con la parte económica  de su socio, pero hoy ya es cosa del pasado y ella debe enfocarse en salir adelante para ver crecer a su hijo de 8 años  disfrutando de buenas condiciones de vida y progresando.
.
texts.en:
Selling household cleaning products was the idea of the business that a study partner and Cecilia C. Arévalo set up,fulfiling the dream of having a small business. But the company did not last very long and the latter had to continue alone with which today is called “Distribuidora Cecy”. At the start it was not easy, but as Cecilia's perseverence has no limits, she decided to continue and today after a year and a half she remains in the market with her own resources and with some financing which at the moment is valuable, because it allowed her to continue and now she dreams of changing to a more commercial sector in order to help her sales and income. This is the first loan with a value of $700,000 COP that Cecilia has had with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, and with it she intends to purchase products by the gallon like degreasing soap and car polishing wax. Her biggest challenge was when she wound up the company and it cost her a lot of work to fulfill her partner's financial share, but today it is already a thing of the past and she has to focus on getting ahead to see her 8 year old son grow up enjoying good living conditions and progressing.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Products by the gallon such as degreasing soap and car polishing wax.

loans.name: Luz Helena

texts.es:
Luz Helena vive en Bogotá,  tiene una peluquería  que inició hace más de 3 años, teniendo en cuenta la profesión de su esposo como estilista;  ellos empezaron con dinero que le facilitó un familiar para poner en marcha su sueño y proyecto de vida familiar. Así Luz Helena y su conyuge, desde esa època se dedican  al trabajo de peluquería, donde ofrece servicios de belleza como blower, masajes, peinados, tinturado, rizado, corte y desrizados de cabellos, que realzan la belleza femenina y masculina y proyectan una imagen elegante, formal o informal, al gusto y dependiendo de las expectativas del cliente. En la actualidad Luz Helena está solicitando su primer financiamiento a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para comprar insumos de peluquería, como tinturas, shampoo, enjuagues, crema de masajes capilar,  todo esto en mayor volumen con relación a como actualmente lo hace, lo cual es de mucha utilidad porque con el crèdito estaría disminuyendo los costos de consumo diario, haciendo este negocio más atractivo y con mayor capacidad de reinvertirle.
Su máximo sueño es crecer con su familia y tener 2 peluquerías, que generen más empleos, y su mayor desafió está ligado justamente al cumplimiento de esa meta,  porque dispone de muy poco tiempo especialmente para la fase inicial de su nuevo plan de negocios, ya que esta actividad le absorbe mucho tiempo, teniendo en cuenta que el barrio donde se desempeñan  es muy comercial y esto hace que el trabajo siempre sea permanente y ademàs porque la atención de sus dos hijos, en las edades de 5 y 10 años  requiere de ella una gran dedidaciòn y un mayor esfuerzo.
texts.en:
Luz Helena lives in Bogotá, she owns a hairdresser’s she opened more than 3 years ago, also considering her husband is a stylist. A relative provided them with enough money to start the business and to set off their dream and their project for their family life. Since then, Luz Helena and her husband have been working in the hairdressing business: they offer beauty treatments such as drying, massaging, hairdos, dyeing, perms, haircuts and hair straightening: they highlight male and female beauty and create new images that, according to the expectations of their customers, can be elegant, formal or informal. Luz Helena is now requesting her first loan to the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo (Mario Santo Domingo Foundation) to buy a wider quantity of hairdresser’s products (dyes, shampoos, hair rinses, conditioners) than the amount she now has, something that would be very useful because with the loan she would reduce the expenses of the daily consumption, thus making this business more appealing and easier to reinvest. Her biggest dream is to grow in this business with her family, and to open 2 hairdresser’s thus generating more work; her biggest challenge is exactly to achieve this goal, as she doesn’t have much time to dedicate to the initial phase of her new business plan. In fact, her present activity takes too much time, since the neighborhood where they work is a busy commercial area, and this means there is always a lot of work for them; moreover, she needs to dedicate a great attention to and a put greater effort in the caring of her two children, aged 5 and 10.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy hairdresser's products.

loans.name: Maria Gertrudis

texts.es:
Desde hace más de 7 años la señora María C., tiene relaciones de crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, porque ella dice que en esta organizaciòn le han brindado la oportunidad de tener un negocio, lo que le significò estar mucho más tiempo con sus hijos y obtener ingresos adicionales que han ayudado a mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia, especialmente en lo relacionado con la infraestructura de su vivienda. Desde un principio ella montó una miscelánea que  posteriormente  vendió para dedicarse a la comercialización de productos por catálogos como ropa, cosméticos, perfumes y accesorios entre otros artículos. 

Ella en la actualidad necesita su sexto crédito para comprar artículos en promociones, porque de esta manera ganan todos: María porque compra económico y  sus clientes porque puede acceder a sus productos con un precio de venta atractivo y accesible, asì ella  impulsa  y mediante este sistema le  traen referidos,  que es  lo que usualmente hace y que refleja la manera de  como María trabaja en su negocio.

Su sueño es viajar con su familia y conocer la Costa caribe, además de  comprar un carro. Quizá para ello deba esperar un poco, pero lo cierto es que  como siente,  que en todos los momentos su negocio le ha dado la mano para solventar las necesidades del hogar, especialmente cuando su esposo quedó sin trabajo durante un año,  lo cual fue una gran experiencia para su vida que la hizo crecer como persona y miembro de familia, así mismo este negocio  le dará para llevar a cabo sus alcanzables sueños.
texts.en:
María Gertrudis has been requesting loans to the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo Mario Santo Domingo Foundation) for more than 7 years, as this institution has offered her the chance to start a business activity: this allowed her more time to spend with her children and to earn additional money she has used to improve the life conditions of her family, notably the supporting structure of her house. She initially opened a corner shop she then sold to dedicate herself to the selling of wholesale products such as clothes, cosmetics, perfumes and accessories among other items. She is now requesting her sixth loan to buy sales promotion products, because this way everybody is a winner: María, who buys cheap, and her customers who can have access to her products at a fair and affordable price. She also promotes herself in this way, in order for her customers to bring others to her shop: this is what she usually does and it represents the way in which María runs her business. Her dreams are to travel with her family and get to know the Caribbean coast, and to buy a car as well. Maybe she will have to wait a while to achieve them, but she really feels that her job will give her the means to make her dreams come true, in the same way it has helped her providing for the necessities of her family in every difficult moment of their life, especially during the year that her husband was out of job, a period that proved to be a great experience for her and that helped her growing both as a person and as member of the family.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sale items like clothing, cosmetics, perfume and women's accessories

loans.name: Nabila Rabia Group

texts.en: Rabia is the daughter of F. B.. She is 41 years old and the leader of Nabila Rabia group in district 7th of Kabul Afghanistan. She lives with her husband and five of her children who are students. Her husband has a metal shop. He is a hard working man and tries to have a comfortable life and educated children. Rabia wants to take out a loan for her husband to expand his business and to buy tools which can make his work easier. He hopes to grow his business soon.

loans.use: to buy tools needed in his work

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Buy items to sell in his store.

loans.name: Fawzia Hafez Group

texts.en:
Mohammad Hafez, 41, is the leader of the Fawzia Hafez group.  He lives in district 7th of Kabul, Afghanistan.  He is married and the father of five children.  Mohammad Hafez has a small cart that he tried to keep full of fresh fruits and vegetables to sell.  He needs a loan to buy more vegetables and fruit to sell to support his family.

Mohammad Hafez is very happy for the chance to get a loan in Afghanistan and that poor workers can use loans to help change their lives.   He says thanks to all lenders around the world.

loans.use: Buy fresh fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Khushbo Jalel Group

texts.en: Tamana is 30 years old and the leader of the Khushbo Jalel group.  She lives in Kabul, Afghanistan.  Tamana is married and has six children.  She wants a loan to support her husband.  He is a butcher, with four years of experience and his income supports their family.  He works hard and wakes up early in the morning to produce a higher monthly income.  Tamana is requested this loan to expand his business by making his shop larger.  Both are grateful to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Help husband expand his business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Help son buy work supplies.

loans.name: Bibi Farahnaz Group

texts.en: Abdull Zahoor is the leader of the Bibi Farahnaz group. He is 31 years old and lives in District 8 of Kabul, Afghanistan.  He is marred and has four children. He sells dry fruit from a cart.  He requests a loan to help make his business vast.  He is confident that this loan will increase his sales.

loans.use: Buy necessary things for his dry fruit cart.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more fresh vegetables for her son's cart

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy some necessary items for his shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy different kinds of fruits and vegetables for her husband's shop

loans.name: Farooq Group

texts.en:
Rahila, the daughter of G. J., is 33 years old and married, with 4 children. She lives in Kabul, Afghanistan and is the leader of Farooq group. She wants to take out a loan for her husband, who has a clothing shop in the city of Kabul. He has been involved in this business for more than 5 years, but now he needs a loan to buy more new clothes for this season.

Rahila would like to thank all lenders from around the world and Kiva in Afghanistan.

loans.use: to buy more new clothes for her husband's shop

loans.name: And-Jef Hlm Rte De Gossas Group

texts.fr:
le groupe AND-JEF du Banc Villageois des HLM Route de GOSSAS est créé il y a de cela 6 mois. Il vient d'effectuer le remboursement de leur premier prêt avec CAURIE-MF et aucune irrégularité n' a été constatée pour le payement des prêts. Elle sont toutes issus du même quartier et effectuent en général le petit commerce de tissus, d'encens, de parfums, de produits cosmétiques etc. Avant d'adhérer à CAURIE-MF elles s'étaient constituées en groupement d'intérêt économique et faisaient des prêts rotatifs et des tontines, ce qui leur permettait d'exercer de petites activités de commerce. Mais depuis qu'elles ont commencer à bénéficier des financements de CAURIE-MF elles ont commencé à intensifier et à élargir leur champ d'activité. Elles sont très solidaires par rapport à des orientations pour la diversification de leurs activités.

Madame Bineta T., la présidente du groupe, à l'extrême droit de la photo, emmitouflée dans un pagne en fleurette, est âgée de 51 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants et aussi tutrice de sa cousine. Elle fait un commerce de tissus depuis plus de 10 ans. Elle s'approvisionne en gros à Dakar et vend dans son quartier et dans les environs. Son nouveau lui servira à renforcer son niveau d'investissement et son objectif est de renforcer son épargne et de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille, par exemple l'enrichissement de la nourriture et assurer la bonne couverture sanitaire de ses enfants.
texts.en:
The group AND-JEF from the Banc Villageois of HLM, on the GOSSAS Road was created 6 months ago. They have just finished repaying their first loan with CAURIE-MF and no irregularity was found in their repayment of their loan. They all come from the same neighborhood and mostly sell cloth, incense, perfume, cosmetics, etc. Before joining CAURIE-MF, they had come together as a group with the same economic interests and participated in "merry-go-round" funds (revolving small loans), which allowed them to stay in business. Since they began to receive CAURIE-MF loans, they have been able to intensify and expand their field of activity. They are very united as far as possibilities for diversifying their businesses go. Madame Bineta T., the president of the group, on the far right in the photo, wrapped in a length of flowered cloth, is 51, married, and the mother of four children as well as being responsible for her cousin. She has been selling cloth for more than 10 years. She buys wholesale in Dakar and sells in her neighborhood and the surrounding areas. Her new loan will serve to reinforce her working capital and her goal is to be able to put aside more savings and help to improve living conditions for her family, for example improving their nutrition and making sure her children have everything they need to stay healthy.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: develop and promote the business activities of the group

loans.name: Buenalyn

texts.en:
The loans that Buenalyn P. has obtained from ASHI since she became a member in 2005 are a great source of cash flow for her family. She was able to finance different income-generating activities and has made small improvements to her family's standard of living. Just last year, Buenalyn started a business buying and selling silver accessories in partnership with her eldest child, Renalyn, who is 30 years old. With this business, Buenalyn and her daughter have profited fairly well and have augmented the income of her husband, who is a hired driver.

Most of all, Buenalyn is happy for the opportunity of financing her own business because she became productive, which improved her temperament. In the future, she hopes to sustain her business and make it stable. Using loans obtained through ASHI, she would like to have her own store in a public place to increase her sales turnover and profit to support her dream of improving her family's quality of life, including her two children who have their own families.

loans.use: to purchase a larger volume of silver fashion accessories for retail

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria A., 53, was one of the poorest among the poor women who joined ASHI in 1997. She hoped that someday through loans requested from ASHI, she would be able to have an established business to support her in bringing her family out of the umbrella of poverty.  She and her husband started cultivating a small parcel of land in their backyard, growing rice and vegetables to sell. They were both very familiar with this occupation from childhood, having learned the skills from their farmer parents. After receiving several loans since joining ASHI, their business eventually improved, as did the quality of their family life. Using her profit, Maria was able to send her two children to a vocational course in college and has been supporting the needs of her eldest child, who is unemployed due to his limited education. 

Since farming is the main source of Maria’s financial need to support her dream of improving her family's standard of living, she hopes to make it sustainable and profitable. With more capital, she plans to purchase equipment, a variety of vegetable seedlings, and a better variety of rice seedlings to increase her sales turnover and profit.

loans.use: To purchase farming supplies such as fertilizers, seedlings, and pesticides for growing rice and vegetables

loans.name: Khat's Group

texts.en: The five people in this group have selected Mrs. Khat S. as their group leader. The group is located in Reang Chuor village, Kandal province. Each group member will use a piece of the loan for her own purposes, and, by so doing, will help improve her family's living conditions. Mrs. Khat S. is 46 years old. She and her husband, Mr. Ban Chea, are farmers who own three-hectares of land, on which they grow crops to support their family. Currently, they are struggling because the soil is infertile. To improve production, consequently, Mrs. Khat S. is seeking for a loan, with which she will buy fertilizer. She is a mother of six children, two of whom are farmers while the others attend the local public school.

loans.use: purchasing fertilizer

loans.name: Sea's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Sea S. , a 32-year old mother of two children who are attending the local public school,  is the leader of a four-perS. group loan In Boeng Kraom village in Kandal Province. Sea is a farmer who owns one-hectare of land upon which she grows crops to sell in order to support her family, while her husband, Mr. Choeurn K., is fisherman.  Sea is now requesting  a loan to buy timber to repair their aging home.

loans.use: To buy timber to repair her house

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Remy

texts.en:
Remy C. is from the village of Bantug. She is 55 years old. Remy is widowed and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Remy owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a tailoring business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing general alterations & tailoring services to local community members. Remy has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Remy joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Remy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional fabrics & materials. Remy is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional tailoring equipment such as needles & threads. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Remy from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional tailoring equipment such as needles & threads

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel M. is from the village of Little Tadian. She is 27 years old. Isabel is married and has 1 infant child. To make a living, Isabel owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Isabel has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Isabel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Isabel is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Isabel from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell in her store

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita M. is from the village of Little Tadian. She is 50 years old. Merlita is married and has 7 school-aged children. To make a living, Merlita owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Merlita has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 3500 PHP when she sells her raised pigs.

In 2010, Merlita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlita is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Merlita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of the borrower's children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Allan

texts.en:
Allan C. is from the town of Talibon. He is 32 years old, married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Allan owns and operates a business venture in the food sector operating a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating a fishing boat to catch and sell assorted fish in the market. Allan has been engaged in his business for over 15 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Allan joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Allan has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Allan is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Allan from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children.

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine M. is from the village of Little Tadian. She is 43 years old. Josephine is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Josephine owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. loans.name: Kermekash's Group

texts.en:
Kermekash N. is the leader of the group. She is 58 and a widow. She has raised two sons and a daughter. The daughter is married and lives separately with her family. The older son went to work to Bishkek to make some money and the younger son helps his parents with housework. Thirty years ago Kermekash, with an initial investment of 5,000 soms (108.88$), began to breed cattle and cultivate different fruits and vegetables. She also sells milk to make money. When necessary, they can sell some cattle to cover their expenses. In this way, Kermekash makes 9,400 soms (204.7$) per month. With money received from the loan she will purchase fuel, which is needed for the sowing process. In the future, she wants to repair her house.

Almaz S., 21, is married.  He has two daughters; both of them are young, so his wife stays at home and takes care of them. He has been breeding cattle and cultivating fruits and vegetables for 10 years. Selling fruits, vegetables and some cattle, Almaz can make 8,100 soms (176.39$) per month. With money received from the loan, he wants to purchase a calf (for breeding) and fuel (needed for the sowing process). In the future, Almaz plans to repair his house and buy a vehicle.

Mira N. is the treasurer of the group. She is 26 and married. She has three sons; the older one studies at school and the others are too young. Mira and her husband have been breeding and selling cattle for 10 years. Mira also sells milk to make money. In this way, she earns 8,100 soms (176.39$) per month. She wants to get a loan to purchase fuel, which is needed to mow clover plants. (In villages, people make money selling the clover, which is the food for cattle.)

Egizbaeva K. is 56 and a widow. She has raised two daughters and a son. All the children study at university. Thirty years ago, K. bought a cow and started to breed cattle and sell milk. She also cultivates fruits and vegetables. In this way she makes 9,000 soms (196$) per month. She has applied for the loan because she needs money to purchase fuel for mowing clover plants.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young, ambitious and socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). Mol Bulak is the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the Mol Bulak Finance staff.

loans.use: To purchase fuel, which is needed for the sowing process.

loans.name: Nyarurooma Adults Group, Bushenyi

texts.en:
Operating a farm has been a tremendous business venture for K. Night from Nyarugote, Bushenyi. Having had a big family of eight children, with a careless husband who is forever thinking of drinking alcohol rather than any other productive work, Night, aged 52 years, worked tooth and nail to start up the sale of bananas which are commonly used to prepare a local dish by customers here in Uganda.

Along with this business Night has a pineapple garden and coffee trees, all of which supplement her income. Thus, she is always able to earn 200,000 Ugandan shillings monthly.

This loan is to help her do the mulching, buy stake poles for her plantation and buy pesticides. This will help her improve her production and sales revenue to enable her take care of her family.

loans.use: To purchase mulches, stake poles and pesticides

loans.name: Kirera Twebeisho Group, Bushenyi

texts.en:
M. Godfrey, a hardworking and reserved 31-year-old married father of three children, has been operating a butchery business in Kigoma Trading Centre in Bushenyi district for over eleven years. He buys cows and goats which he slaughters and prepares the meat ready for selling to his genuine customers who have supported him this long.

Godfrey’s business has grown to the extent that he has been able to educate all his three children. In a month, he reveals he makes close to 200,000 Ugandan shillings. He also sells matooke (plantain) as a source of side income and makes some additional income through his retail shop.

Godfrey’s drawback is having only a small amount of stock in his businesses. Therefore, he would like to use this loan to restock his retail shop and also buy more animals.

Godfrey’s future plans are to expand his business and improve his sales revenue.

loans.use: To restock his store and to buy more animals for his butchery business

loans.name: Leang

texts.en:
Leang L. is a 56-year-old widowed mother. She has six children, two of whom are now married and the other four of whom are single. She lives with other family members in her own small family home in Kompong Tom province.
Leang L. owns a piece of land that she inherited from her parents. She grows different kinds of crop on her land, such as cabbages, cucumbers, and potatoes, which she sells to buyers every two or three months when the plants mature. She has many partners in her teenage children who grow the crops with her. Leang L. will be using this loan as capital to grow potato crops.

loans.use: To grow potato crops
