29 year old Isai is a loving husband and father who lives with his wife, 28 year old Eliana, and his two lovely children, eight year old Araceli, and four year old Scott. They are the prime motivation for all of his efforts. With his wife’s help, Isai has managed to succeed with his coffee plantations. They have both worked very hard to produce high quality products. Whenever he travels to Pichanaki to sell his coffee, buyers have no problem offering him good prices. He’s been doing this for 29 years and what he enjoys most is taking care of his plantations. What he finds most difficult is transporting his product to the points of sale. In time he wants to buy a car in order to be able to move his product himself. This will be his third loan through MFP and he tells us that this will be very helpful toward his progress. He will use the money from this loan to buy three hectares of land where he will plant bananas.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Land for farming

loans.name: Walter Agustin

texts.es:
Walter es casado, tiene 55 años de edad y vive junto a su esposa y una de sus tres hijos en el distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz, conocido por ser el distrito mas poblado de la región y también el que tiene mayores indices de pobreza, ubicado 5 minutos del centro de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Tiene 20 años trabajando como transportista, inicialmente alquilaba vehículos para ganarse el sustento familiar, luego pudo comprarse un auto en el año 2006, actualmente utiliza este vehículo como herramienta de trabajo, está asociado a una empresa de taxis que brinda sus servicios a los clientes del centro comercial más grande de la ciudad.

Walter se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1900 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en el mantenimiento de su vehículo, ya que debido al continuo uso que le otorga siempre tiene que mantenerlo en buen estado para garantizar su correcto funcionamiento. Esta es la segunda vez que trabaja con el fondo Kiva y la tercera en que trabaja con Edpyme Alternativa, el se encuentra agradecido con los prestamistas de Kiva ya que gracias a ellos puede seguir trabajando en su vehículo sin problemas.

El desea instalar un negocio de comercio en su vivienda para asi poder obtener una fuente adicional de ingresos. Walter es considerado como un cliente excelente por nuestra Institución ya que ha demostrado responsabilidad y puntualidad al momento de cancelar sus cuotas.
texts.en:
55-year old Walter is married and lives with his wife and one of their three children in José Leonardo Ortiz district, recognized as the most populated and with the highest levels of poverty in the area. It is located five minutes from the centre of the town of Chiclayo. Walter has worked in transportation for 20 years, firstly renting vehicles to earn his living, and then buying his own car in 2006. Nowadays he uses this vehicle when he drives for the taxi business with which he is associated. He offers his services to customers visiting the biggest mall in the town. Walter is asking Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1,900 soles which he is planning to use to maintain his vehicle. As it is in continuous use, he has to keep it in good condition so he can be sure that it will always run well. This is the second time that he has worked with Kiva and the third with Edpyme Alternativa. He is grateful to Kiva donors as it is thanks to them that he can keep his vehicle well-maintained. He wants to open a business centre in his home and in this way have an additional source of income. He is considered an excellent client by our organization since he has always shown responsibility and punctual repayments of his loans.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: José, de 53 años, es un hombre que a lo largo de su vida siempre ha trabajado muy duro por sobresalir, vive en su casa propia junto a su última hija Zenaida y sus dos pequeños nietos, quienes son la alegría de todos sus días. Los años le han enseñado a José que el trabajo bien realizado da su recompensa, es por eso que todas las mañanas desde muy temprano trabaja en sus chacras, para volverlas más productivas. Sus productos él los lleva a vender en las Cooperativas de Pichanaki quienes le ofrecen un muy buen precio por su café. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus plantaciones de café, ya que es el producto que le genera su principal ingreso, lleva 25 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es fumigar sus tierras ya que expone su salud. Para más adelante, espera comprar nuevas tierras para ampliar sus plantaciones. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, siente que este aporte le ayuda mucho en el desarrollo de su actividad. En su grupo comunal es un socio, muy responsable, de lo cual se siente muy orgulloso. Con los mil doscientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono e insecticidas para sus tierras.
texts.en:
José is 53 years old and has always worked hard throughout his life in order to excel. He lives in his own home with his youngest daughter Zenaida and his two small grandchildren who provide him joy every day. Over the years, José has learned that hard work is rewarded. For this reason, he wakes up early every morning to begin the work in his fields in hopes of productive returns. He brings his products to sell to the cooperatives in Pichanaki, where he is offered a very good price for his coffee. What he enjoys most about his work is growing coffee, since this crop provides his main source of income. José has been farming for 25 years and considers the most difficult part to be fumigating his land since it can be a potential hazard to his health. In the future, he hopes to buy new plots of land so that he can increase production.

This is his third loan with MFP. José feels that this contribution will be a great help to the development of his business. He is proud of the fact that he is recognized as one of the most responsible members of his Communal Bank. With this loan of 1200 PEN that he requested, José will buy more compost and insecticides for his farmland.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase compost & insecticides

loans.name: Adriana Mercedes

texts.es:
Adriana de 28 años, vive en la Primavera de Duran (perímetro urbano fue originalmente irregular, con varios cerros, riachuelos y lagunas que aún se presentan como restos de una ecología en disolución), tiene dos hijos. 

Por la falta de oportunidades y la desesperante idea de tener ingresos para sus hijos ella es empleada domestica, con los pocos ingresos que ha tenido ha invertido su dinero en productos naturales para vender a sus amigos y conocidos. 

Pero como la casa de Adriana no es muy cómoda para sus hijos ella quiere construirla y mejorarla. Con el préstamo quiere comprar cemento, piedras y pinturas ( en la foto aparece una parte de su casa que ya ha construido) 

En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
28-year old Adriana lives in La Primavera de Duran (an area on the outskirts of the city that originally had an irregular landscape, with several hills, streams, and lakes that even today appears to be an environment at breaking point). Adriana has two children. Due to lack of opportunities and a desperate need to earn money to support her children, she works as a maid. With the small amount of money that she earned, she bought natural products to sell to friends and acquaintances. As her house is not very comfortable for her children, she wishes to rebuild and improve it. With the loan she plans to buy cement, stones, and paint (the photo shows the part of her house that has already been built). Her goal for the future is to complete the construction of her house.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy cement and stones

loans.name: Dios Es Nuestro Amparo 1 Group

texts.en:
Luchi is the coordinator of her group, Dios es Nuestro Amparo (God is our Protection), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti). Her group is located in the slums north of the capital, Santo Domingo, an area where crime is rampant and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and their two children.
Luchi is excited to be taking her sixth loan with Kiva partner, Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling shoes by purchasing men's shoes and sandals, women's shoes (with and without heels) and purses to sell. She will use the profits to invest in inverters for her home to deal with frequent blackouts, as well as save towards repairing her roof. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase men's shoes and sandals, women's shoes and purses for resale

loans.name: Coumba

texts.fr: Madame Coumba D., née en 1966 est vendeuse de légumes depuis plus de 20 ans. C'était depuis qu'elle a rejoint le domicile conjugal sis à Notto, que Madame Coumba D. s'est lancée dans cette activité dominatrice dans la zone où la culture maraîchère  constitue le secteur le plus prisé. Cependant elle sollicitait un prêt de 50 000 FCFA pour renforcer son business. Ainsi avec cet investissement elle verra son travail se développé et pourra soutenir son mari et prendre en charge la scolarité de son enfant qui étudie actuellement dans la ville de Mboro située à plus de 50 Kms de Thiès.
texts.en:
Mrs. Columba D., born in 1966, has been selling vegetables for over 20 years. Ever since she came to live with her husband in Notto, she has been working in this line of business, very prominent in this region as vegetable gardening is one of the main activities here. And thus she is seeking a loan of 50,000 West African Franks to bolster her business. With this investment, her business would be strengthened and she could help her husband as well as take care of the school fees of her child, who know studies in the town of Mboro, 50 km [30 miles] from Thiès.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthening her business

loans.name: Ndieme

texts.fr: Madame Ndieme K. évolue dans la couture et le commerce de tissus et d’habits depuis 10ans. C’est une femme divorcée  de 54 ans qui est membre de l’U-IMCEC à la caisse de  Ouakam depuis 9 ans déjà. Elle a en charge un garçon  qui fait ses études  à l’extérieur. Elle a choisi cette activité  dans le but d’acquérir  un revenu qui lui permettra de soutenir son fils et subvenir a ses besoins. Elle sollicite un crédit  de 250 000 frs dans le but d’acheter des tissus pour la confection d’habits qu’elle commercialise. Elle a déjà  rembourse 3 prêts antérieurs  et ces crédits  lui ont permit  d’acquérir  une certaine indépendance  financière.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ndieme K. has been working as a seamstress and selling clothes and fabric for ten years. She is divorced, 54 years old and has been a member of the Ouakam branch of U-IMCEC already for nine years already. She has to support a young boy who is in a school out of town. She has chosen this activity in order to be able to obtain an income permitting her to support her son and herself. She is seeking a credit of 250,000 West African Francs, with the goal of purchasing fabric for sewing clothes which she will then offer for sale. She already repaid three prior loans; these loans have helped her obtain a certain degree of financial independence.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business investment

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es: El Sr. A. A. Marcelino, vive en la urbanización Sebastían Barranca, perteneciente al distrito de Santiago. Tiene a cargo a su madre quien es viuda. Trabaja como obrero de campo en agrícola la venta desde hace 2 años. Vive en casa de su hermano a la cual le esta realizando acabados. Solicita el financiamiento para apoyar con la realización de los acabados de la vivienda de su hermano a fin de poder brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su madre. El Sr. A. agradece el apoyo que le podamos brindar a través de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Sr. Marcelino A. A. lives in the neighborhood of Sebastían Barranca, which is part of the district of Santiago. He looks after his mother who is a widow. Marcelino has been working as a field laborer for two years. He lives at his brother’s house which is undergoing the final touches. Marcelino is requesting a loan to help complete the finishing touches to his brother’s house in order to provide a better quality of life for their mother. He is grateful for the support that has been provided with this financing.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Mejoramiento de vivienda

loans.name: Livio

texts.es: Livio, de 34 años, es un hombre muy trabajador y alegre, vive en su casa propia y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. Trabajando muy duro, Livio ha logrado que sus chacras se vuelvan muy fértiles y productivas. Todos los días trabaja en sus campos agrícolas, haciendo que sus cultivos cada vez sean mejores. Lo cosechado lo lleva a vender al mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma, donde generalmente recibe muy buena paga. Lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar y verlos desarrollar, sin embargo considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hacia el mercado. Con el tiempo, espera comprar nuevas tierras para ampliar sus plantaciones. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus anteriores créditos y espera serlo ahora también. En su grupo comunal, es un socio muy responsable y siempre esta al tanto de los acuerdos a los que llegan en el grupo. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono e insecticidas para preparar y proteger sus tierras.
texts.en:
Livio is 34 years old and a cheerful hardworking gentleman. He lives in his own home and what he wants most is to improve his quality of life. Livio works extremely hard to make his land fertile and productive. Every day he works in his fields to make his crops better with each harvest. He sells his products at the wholesale market in the city of Tarma, where he generally receives a good price. Livio has been farming for 15 years and what he enjoys most is planting his crops and seeing them develop. However, he considers the most difficult part of his job to be transporting his products to market. Over time, he hopes to acquire new land to increase his production.

This is his second loan with MFP. He has been prompt in repaying his previous loans and hopes to do the same now. In his Communal Bank, he is a responsible member and is always aware of the agreements that have been reached in his group. With the loan of 1500 PEN that he requested, Livio will buy more compost and insecticides to prepare and protect his farmland.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase compost & insecticides

loans.name: Mame Diarra Group

texts.fr: Le groupement Mame Diarra compte à son actif 5 femmes comme seules membres. Il est dirigé par Madame Saye Sy B. âgée de 42 ans. Cette dame très dynamique s'active dans la restauration depuis plus de 10 ans. C'est un métier qu'elle a hérité de sa mère qui était une très grande restauratrice. Avec sa part du prêt, erlle souhaitait renforcer son stock riz et huile afin de mieux se préparer par rapports à la marche du marché. Elle compte également se lancer dans la vente de diner et ne plus se limiter aux petits déjeuners et déjeuners. Elle partage ce groupe avec 4 autres femmes qui s'activent dans le commerce de légumes. Elles sont Madame Fatou N. la trésorière, Madme Khady S., Madame Moussé Djiguène S. et Madame Khoudia N..
texts.en:
The group 'Mame Diarra' is made up of exactly five women. It is led by Mrs. Saye Sy B., 42. This very dynamic lady has been working in the cooked food business for more than 10 years. She inherited this business from her mother who was a well-known seller of cooked food. With her share of the loan, she hopes to bolster her stock of rice and oil, so that she can prepare as much as is needed on any given day. She hopes to be able to sell dinners, and not be limited to serving only breakfast and lunch. She shares the group with four other women who sell vegetables. They are Mrs. Fatou N., treasurer, Mrs. Khady S., Mrs. Moussé Djiguène S., and Mrs. Khoudia N..

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying rice and oil for her cooked food business

loans.name: Julian

texts.es: El Sr. A. A. Julian, vive en la urbanización Sebastían Barranca B-14, perteneciente al Distrito de Santiago. Tiene a cargo a su madre quien es viuda . Trabaja como obrero de campo  en  Agrícola Chapi desde hace 2 años. Cuenta con casa propia a la cual le esta realizando acabados. Solicita el financiamiento para realizar acabados a su vivienda a fin de poder brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su madre. El Sr. A. agradece el apoyo que le podamos brindar a través de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Sr. Julian A. A. lives in the neighborhood of Sebastían Barranca B-14, which is part of the district of Santiago. He looks after his mother who is a widow. Julian has been working as a field laborer on the Chapi Farm for two years. He has his own house and is making the final touches.

Julian is requesting a loan so that he can complete the finishing touches to his home so that he can provide his mother a better quality of life. He is grateful for the support that has been provided with this financing.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Complete the finishing touches to his house

loans.name: Luz De Madre 5 Group

texts.en:
Ramona is the coordinator of her group, Luz de Madre (Light of the Mother), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti). Her group is located in Los Alcarrizos, a dusty industrial area north of the capital, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their three children.
Ramona is excited to be taking her second loan with Kiva partner, Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling hair products by purchasing more shampoo, rinse and conditioner to sell. She will use the profits to invest in inverters for her house (large batteries that charge when the power is on to counteract frequent blackouts). She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase shampoo, rinse and conditioner for resale

loans.name: Jose Carlos

texts.es: El Sr. M. N. Jose Carlos, es natural de Ica. Actualmente vive en el Caserio de Conuca perteneciente al distrito de Pueblo Nuevo, junto a su esposa y su  hija. Trabaja como obrero de construcción en una ladrillera. Su esposa trabaja como obrera de campo desde hace 2 años en diferentes fundos. Solicita financiamiento para  terminar la construcción de su vivienda ya que gracias a su empeño a podido avanzar en parte de esta construcción. Su sueño es poder brindar una mejor calidad de vida para su familia. El Sr. M. N. Jose Carlos agradece el apoyo que le podamos brindar a tráves de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Sr. Jose Carlos M. N. is a native of Ica. He currently lives with his wife and daughter in the village of Conuca, which is in the district of Pueblo Nuevo. Jose Carlos is employed at a brick factory. His wife has been working as a field laborer for the past two years on different farms.

He is requesting a loan so that he can finish the construction of his home. Thanks to his efforts, he has been able to accomplish part of the construction. His dream is to provide a better quality of life for his family. Sr. Jose Carlos is grateful for the support that has been provided through this financing.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finish the construction of his house

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: Lucia, de 43 años, es una mujer sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia con su esposo Esteban de 55 años y sus 4 menores hijos, a quienes desea brindarle una mejor calidad de vida. Con mucho esfuerzo Lucia ha logrado trabajar sus tierras y volverlas muy productivas. Entre los productos que cultiva son café y sachainchi, productos que tiene mucha demanda en el mercado, en donde son llevados a vender al por mayor en el mercado de Pichanaki. Lleva 8 años realizando esta actividad y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus campos agrícolas, sin embargo considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta Pichanaki, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados y la cansan mucho. Más adelante, desea comprar nuevas tierras para ampliar sus plantaciones. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus anteriores créditos y espera serlo también ahora. En su grupo comunal es una socia muy participativa y siempre esta al tanto de los acuerdos a los que llegan en su grupo. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita, hará limpiar su chacra y para ello contratará peones para que la ayuden a  limpiar y cultivar.
texts.en:
Lucia is 43 years old and a modest hardworking woman. She lives in her own home with her husband Esteban (age 55) and their four young children for whom she wants to provide a better quality of life. With great effort, Lucia strives to work her land so that she can generate productive returns. Among the crops she grows are coffee and “Sacha Inchi” (a plant indigenous to the Amazon which is used for making oil). These products are in high demand in the marketplace. Lucia transports her harvest to the market in Pichanaki to sell wholesale. She has been engaged in this activity for eight years and enjoys most taking care of her fields. However, she considers the most difficult part of her job to be transporting her products to Pichanaki since the sacks she has to carry are extremely heavy and cause her great fatigue. In the future, she wants to buy additional farmland so that she can increase her production.

This is her third loan with MFP. Lucia has been prompt in repaying her previous loans and hopes to do the same now. In her Communal Bank, she is an active participant and is always aware of the agreements that have been reached in her group. With the loan of 1000 PEN that she requested, Lucia will hire workers to help clear her land and prepare it for planting.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Hire workers to clear and prepare her farmland for planting

loans.name: Victor Nicolas

texts.es:
Victor tiene 55 años de edad, es separado y vive solo en la ciudad de Chiclayo, ciudad bastante conocida por su movimiento comercial y de transporte, es la capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a trabajar desde hace diez años vendiendo sandalias y zapatillas en el exterior del mercado del distrito de Pomalca, un distrito agrícola situado a quince minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Todos los dias viaja hacia ese centro de abasto para comercializar la mercadería que previamente ha adquirido en el Mercado Modelo de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Esta actividad es su unica fuente de ingreso, por lo que siempre trata de mantenerla de la mejor manera.

Victor desea adquirir mas mercadería para ampliar su negocio, el desea incursionar en la venta de calzado para damas y desea obtener un poco de capital para lograr su cometido, por ello se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.

Victor es un hombre trabajador y que se ha sabido ganar el cariño y estima de las personas que lo conocen. Su mayor anhelo es poder tener un puesto formal para ofrecer su mercadería.
texts.en:
Victor is 55 years old. He is separated and lives alone in Chiclayo, a city known as a business and transportation center. Chiclayo is also the capital of the Lambayeque region. Since he was 10 years old, Victor has sold sandals and gym shoes outside of the market of the Pomalca district, an agricultural district 15 minutes from Chiclayo. Every day he commutes to his place near the Pomalca market to sell merchandise that he has acquired in the Mercado Modelo in Chiclayo. This activity is his only source of income, and therefore he always does his best to promote and maintain it. Victor wishes to acquire more merchandise to expand his business: to sell women's footwear. He has requested for the first time a loan of 5oo nuevos soles ($200) from Edpyme Alternativa in order to turn his wish into reality. Victor is a hard-working man who knows how to win the warmth and esteem of the people he meets. His great desire is to have a small store from which he can sell his merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of women's footwear and expansion of his business

loans.name: Fuente De Bendicion 1,2 Group

texts.en:
Jose is the coordinator of his group, Fuente D. Bendicion (Source of Blessing), and his story is representative of his group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti). His group is located in Puerto Plata, a port town on the north coast, where the economy is dependent on tourism and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. He makes his home here in a simple structure with his children.
Jose is excited to be taking his first loan with Kiva partner, Esperanza, after being denied access to credit from other sources. He plans to use this loan to invest in his business making cleaning products by purchasing the chemicals he needs to produce his cleaning products. He will use the profits to feed his children. His long-term goal is to grow his business and add more products. He thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase chemicals to produce cleaning products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Build an additional room to be used as a kitchen

loans.name: Gladys Yolanda

texts.es:
Gladys de 44 años, vive en la Primavera de Duran (perímetro urbano fue originalmente irregular, con varios cerros, riachuelos y lagunas que aún se presentan como restos de una ecología en disolución) tiene dos hijos. 

Gladys cuando era niña le hizo una promesa a su abuela que iba aprender a ser costurera, desde los 15 años ella comenzó a estudiar costureria, después de terminar sus estudios trabajo en una fabrica de ropa, poco a poco fue desempeñando su profesión de costurera. Ahora ella tiene una pequeña maquina de coser y trabaja todos los días desde su casa.  

Pero para tener mejores resultados y mas producción de ropa quiere comprar con el préstamo una maquina de coser industrial. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Forty-four-year-old Gladys lives in the Primavera de Duran (the city limits were originally irregular, with various hills, streams, and lakes, which still exist as remains of a vanishing ecology). She has two children. When Gladys was a girl, she promised her grandmother that she would become a seamstress. At age 15, Gladys began to study sewing; after she finished her studies, she worked in a clothes factory. Slowly she developed and grew as a seamstress. Now she has a small sewing machine and works from her home every day. To achieve better results and more production, however, she wishes to buy with this loan an industrial sewing machine. In the future, she would like to finish building her house.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase an industrial sewing machine

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce A. smokes fish for sale in Abura. To smoke her fish, she goes to the seashore to buy fresh fish from the seamen. She comes home with the fish, cleans or dresses them, and drains the water that comes about as a result of washing the fish. She prepares her traditionally-made oven with firewood to smoke her fish for sale.

Joyce is married and has three children. She has no educational background. Her husband is a mason. Joyce uses her income to help her husband provide for basic needs such as food, clothing and shelter for the family. Joyce will use this loan to purchase more fresh fish to smoke for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Joyce plans to save to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase more fresh fish to smoke for sale

loans.name: Marlo

texts.es: Marlo, de 25 años, es un joven muy responsable y trabajador, vive solo en su casa propia y lo que más desea es tener un mejor futuro. La juventud de Marlo no ha sido un impedimento, para que con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación haya podido sobresalir en la vida. Él heredó hace unos años, unas tierras que sus padres le otorgaron, las cuales trabajó y cuidó muy bien, gracias a esto sus productos se vendieron muy bien y obtuvo un buen capital para poner el negocio que realmente deseaba, ya que paralelamente a sus cultivos, estudiaba la carrera de técnico agropecuario y ahora con sus ahorros ha logrado poner una tienda de fertilizantes y productos de la zona. Lleva 5 años trabajando en agricultura y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que lo administra él solo, sin embargo considera que lo más difícil es fumigar sus tierras. Con el tiempo, espera que su tienda crezca y se convierta en una de las más importantes de la zona. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas puntualmente si desea acceder a otro crédito posteriormente. En su grupo comunal, es un socio muy participativo. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará abono y fertilizantes, para mejorar la productividad de sus tierras.
texts.en:
Marlo is 25 years of age and a responsible and hardworking young man. He lives alone in his own house and what he wants most is to have a better future. Marlo’s youth has not been a hindrance since he works with great effort and dedication to excel in life. A few years ago, he inherited some land from his parents. By working and taking good care of the land, his products have generated very good sales and allowed him to build up a considerable amount of capital to establish the business he really wanted. In addition to farming, Marlos is studying to earn a technical degree in agriculture. With his savings, he is now able to open a store selling fertilizers and local products. He has been farming for five years and says he enjoys working by himself. Nonetheless, he considers the most difficult part about his job to be fumigating his farmland. Over time he hopes his store will grow so that it will become one of the most important businesses in the area.

This is his third loan with MFP. Marlo knows he has to submit his payments promptly if he wants to access subsequent loans. He is an active participant in his Communal Bank. With the loan of 2000 PEN that he requested, Marlo will buy compost and fertilizers so that he can improve the productivity of his land.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase compost & fertilizers

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua N. prepares Fante kenkey for sale in Abura. To prepare her kenkey, she buys maize from the market and soaks it in a lot, or enough, water to soften the maize. She washes it on the third day and sends it to the mill to be milled. She then makes a mixture of dough out of the milled wet corn and leaves it to prove for the next day. She divides the proved dough into two and uses one half for her firm half-cooked dough. She mixes it with water to get it into a porridge form, cooks it for some time to get a firm mixture or texture of the dough. Then she mixes the rest of the uncooked dough with the half-cooked portion. She moulds into balls and wraps them in corn husk. She cooks them again till they become soft to eat. Kenkey can be eaten with various kinds of sauces such as pepper sauce, with fried or roasted fish, roasted chicken, roasted turkey or any other kind of meat or fish.

Ekua is married to a farmer and has four children. She has been through junior high school. Ekua uses her income to help her husband pay for accommodation and take care of the family. Ekua will use this loan to buy more bags of corn to prepare kenkey for sale. Ekua plans to reinvest the new profits from her extended business back into her business.

loans.use: To buy more bags of corn to prepare kenkey for sale

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es: El Sr. T. O. Alejandro de 26 años de edad, vive con su conyugue y sus 2 pequeños hijos. Viven en casa propia, la cual se encuentra ubicada en el Caserío Santa Matilde. Trabaja como obrero de campo en la Empresa Robsons S.A.C. Su conyugue es obrera eventual. El Sr. es una persona muy emprendedora, que gracias a su empeño logro salir adelante y pudo construir parte de su vivienda. El Sr. T. requiere el crédito para poder terminar de construir su casa. Su sueño, según nos comenta es terminar de construir dicha vivienda, para poder tener una mejor calidad de vida. El Sr T. esta muy agradecido por el apoyo que le podamos brindar a través de este  financiamiento.
texts.en:
Sr. Alejandro T. O. is 26 years old, married, and has two small children. He and his family live in their own house located in the village of Santa Matilde. Alejandro is employed as a field worker for the Robsons Company, SAC. His wife is a seasonal worker. Sr. Alejandro is an enterprising person who, through his determination, has been able to move forward and proceed with the construction of part of his home.

Sr. T. needs a loan to complete the construction of his house. He says that his dream is to finish building his home so that he can have a better quality of life. Sr. T. is extremely grateful for the support that has been provided through this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finish the construction of his house

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase hair treatments and conditioners for her salon

loans.name: Bryan Antonio

texts.es: El señor Bryan de 29 años de edad es comerciante, se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general el ofrece sus mercaderías de manera ambulante, porque tiene una amplia variedad de productos. Actualmente tiene bastantes pedidos pues se acerca el día de la madre y necesita complacer los pedidos de sus clientes. Desde muy joven  inicio con este negocio, pues por medio de su hermana y su esposa fue que el decidió integrarse en esta actividad que ha sido muy provechosa para su familia. Solicita el préstamo a Fundación para la compra de más mercaderías. Sueña con mejorar cada día su actividad pues lo importante es relacionarse con sus clientes.
texts.en:
Señor Bryan, who is 29 years old, is a merchant. He makes his living selling general merchandise, and he offers his products via a mobile business because he sells a wide variety of products. He currently has a lot of orders because Mother's Day is approaching, and he needs to complete his customers' orders. He started his business when he was quite young. His sister and his wife encouraged him to get into this business, and it has been very profitable for his family. He is requesting the loan from Fundación in order to purchase merchandise. He hopes to continue to improve his business because it is very important to build good relationships with his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua A. prepares Fante kenkey for sale in Abura.To prepare her kenkey, she buys maize from the market and soaks it in a lot, or enough, water to soften the maize. She washes it on the third day and sends it to the mill to be milled. She then makes a mixture of dough out of the milled wet corn and leaves it to prove for the next day. She divides the proved dough into two and uses one half for her firm half-cooked dough. She mixes it with water to get it into a porridge form, cooks it for some time to get a firm mixture or texture of the dough. Then she mixes the rest of the uncooked dough with the half-cooked portion. She moulds into balls and wraps them in corn husk. She cooks them again till they become soft to eat. Kenkey can be eaten with various kinds of sauces such as pepper sauce, with fried or roasted fish, roasted chicken, roasted turkey or any other kind of meat or fish.

Ekua is married and lives with six dependants. Ekua has not had any form of education. With the little income she makes from her sales, Ekua helps her husband take care of the family. Ekua will use this loan to purchase more maize to prepare Fante kenkey for distribution to her customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua plans to save to build a kenkey factory in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more maize to prepare Fante kenkey for distribution to her customers

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es: Patricia de 30 años es una madre de familia muy trabajadora y alegre, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Arnaldo de 39 años y sus 6 hijos, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Trabajando arduamente Patricia ha logrado sacar adelante sus sembríos, todas las mañanas se levanta muy temprano para regar y brindarle el cuidado respectivo a su café y achiote los cuales posteriormente venderá en la ciudad de Pichanaki, ya que es ahí donde obtiene los mejores precios por sus productos. Disfruta mucho de la libertad que tiene al trabajar en sus campos, es así que ya lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que trabajar la tierra. Con el tiempo, espera poder adecuar sus tierras para plantar mucho más café. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, sabe que este crédito le ayudará bastante en el progreso y desarrollo de su negocio, es por eso que esta dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, en su grupo comunal es una socia muy responsable, motivo por el cual es muy querida. Con los ochocientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono y fertilizantes, para mejorar la calidad de sus tierras.
texts.en:
Patricia, who is 30 years old, is a hardworking and happy mother. She lives in her own home with her 39-year old husband, Arnaldo, and their 6 children, to whom she hopes to give a better quality of life. By working arduously, Patricia has managed to improve her plantings. She gets up very early every morning to water and care for her coffee and annatto, which she will later sell in the city of Pichanaki, where she gets the best prices for her products. She very much enjoys the freedom of working in the fields, which she has been doing for 20 years. She feels that the most difficult part is having to work the land. With time, she hopes to adapt her land to plant a lot more coffee. This is her third loan with MFP. She knows that this loan will help her quite a bit in the progress and development of her business, and for that reason she is determined to make all her payments punctually. She is a very responsible member of her communal group, which is why she is dear to them. With the 800 PEN she is requesting, she will purchase more manure and fertilizer to improve the quality of her land.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase manure and fertilizer to imrove the quality of the land.

loans.name: Amidgar

texts.es: El Sr. A. C. Amidgar vive en el Sector la Hacienda Vieja, perteneciente al distrito de Santiago, junto a su esposa y su  hijo. Trabaja en el fundo IQF. su esposa tambien trabaja como obrera de campo desde hace 2 años. Solicita financiamiento para  la construcción  de su vivienda, ya que gracias a su esfuerzo y trabajo a podido construir parte de su vivienda. Su sueño es poder brindar una mejor calidad de vida para su familia y brindarle educación a su hija. El Sr. A. C. Amidgar agradece el apoyo que le podamos brindar a travez de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Amidgar lives with his wife and son in the La Hacienda Vieja sector, of the Santiago district. He works for the IQF. His wife also works as a field laborer and has done so for two years. He is asking for this loan in order to finish building his home. Thanks to hard work and effort, he has been able to build part of it. He wants to be able to provide a better quality of life for his family and provide an education for his daughter. Amidgar is grateful for the support he has gotten through this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvement

loans.name: La Cosecha 2 Group

texts.en:
Ana is the coordinator of her group, La Cosecha (The Harvest), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti). Her group is located in Los Alcarrizos, a dusty industrial area north of the city, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their two children.
Ana is excited to be taking her third loan with Kiva partner, Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business running a beauty salon by purchasing more beauty products. She will use the profits to save towards expanding her salon. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase beauty products for her salon

loans.name: La Fe (Grupos 1-5) Group

texts.en:
Aurelia is the coordinator of her group La Fe (Faith), and her story is representative of both her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in La Romana, a rural area of the country dedicated to the sugar cane harvest, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their six children.

Aurelia is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza, after having fully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her small clothing sales business by purchasing necessary supplies - undergarments and other articles. She will use the profits to improve the well-being of her family and grow her business. Aurelia hopes to have her own house in the future. She thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: To buy supplies for a small undergarment sales business

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: Nana A. produces a body cream called shea butter for sale in Abura. Nana has received junior high education and she is married to a carpenter. Together with her husband, they take care of their three children. Her loan is going to serve as additional capital to buy other cosmetics which she is going to add to her shea butter to sell. She anticipates reinvesting in her business.

loans.use: To buy other cosmetics to add to her shea butter to sell

loans.name: Ronald

texts.es: Ronald, de 23 años, es joven muy alegre y trabajador, vive solo en su casa propia y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. La actividad a la que se dedica Ronald, es el cultivo de café y maíz, las plantaciones que posee, lo han convertido en un gran productor. Sus productos los vende en la ciudad de Pichanaki, donde ya tiene compradores esperándolo, ya que sus productos son de muy buena calidad. Lleva 8 años realizando esta actividad y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar el café y lo hace con mucho empeño, sin embargo considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus plantaciones de las plagas que pueden afectarlas. En el futuro, desea comprar un carro, en el cual pueda transportar sus productos hacia los puntos de venta. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, está dispuesto a pagar sus cuotas puntualmente y para eso ya está empezando a ahorrar. En su grupo comunal es un socio muy alegre y siempre está muy al tanto de los acuerdos a los que llegan en sus reuniones. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita, contratará peones para que lo ayuden en el cultivo.
texts.en:
Ronald is a 23 year old hard working and happy young man. He lives alone in his own house and wants to improve his quality of life. Ronald raises coffee and corn and his plantations have made his a grand producer. He sells his crop in the city of Pichanaki, where he has regular buyers who await his product because of its high quality. He has been doing this for eight years and what he enjoys most about his work is harvesting the coffee, which he does with great enthusiasm. His greatest challenge is caring for his plantation, so that they are not affected by blights. He would eventually like to buy a car so that he can transport his product to their points of sale. This will be his third loan through MFP and he is prepared to make his payments on time and has already begun to save his money. He is a jolly member of his communal bank and will use the money from this loan to hire field hands.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Hire field hands

loans.name: Rosa Eligia

texts.es: Rosa Eligia tiene 47 años.  No es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos pues siempre son necesarios en su vida y negocio. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta y elaboración de especies, por lo que tiene más de 8 años con este negocio, pues tiene que buscar como sufragar los gastos de los estudios de su hijo. Con el paso del tiempo ha logrado adquirir más experiencia en el negocio y mejorar la comunicación con sus clientes. Actualmente está solicitando este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima como leña, azúcar, arroz, saborizantes, bolsas entre otras cosas. sueña con que sus hijos finalicen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Rosa Eligia is 47 years old. This is not the first time that she has had loans; they have always been necessary in her life and her business. Her economic activity is preparing and selling spices. She has been in this business for more than 8 years, since she has to figure out how to deal with the expenses of her son's schooling. As time has passed, she has acquired more experience in the business and has improved communication with her customers. At this time she is asking for this loan to buy raw materials such as firewood, sugar, rice, seasonings and bags among other things. Her dream is for her children to finish their education.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mujeres Capacitadas Group

texts.en:
Justa is the coordinator of her group Mujeres Capacitadas (Capable Women), and her story is representative both of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in Puerto Plata, a northern port town whose economy is dependent on tourism and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure as a single mother with her four children.

Justa is excited to be taking her fifth loan with Esperanza after having fully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling chicharrones (fried pork fat) and clothing by purchasing pork, pants, panties and bras to sell. She will use the profits to invest in her home by changing the walls from wood to cement block, a major improvement in the termite-infested, hurricane-prone Dominican Republic. Justa thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: Pork, two dozen pairs of pants, panties, and bras

loans.name: La Fuerza De Cristo Group

texts.en:
Marcelo is the coordinator of his group, La Fuerza de Cristo (The Force of God), and his story is representative of his group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti).

Marcelo’s group is located in La Romana, a rural area of he country dedicated to the sugar cane harvest, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. He makes his home there in a simple structure with his wife and their one child.

Marcelo is excited to be taking his second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid his previous loan and grown his business. He plans to use this loan to invest in his food sales business, a small neighborhood general grocery store (colmado), by purchasing necessary products for sale: rice, sugar, oil, etc.

Marcelo will use the profits to work towards expanding his colmado in the future. He hopes his dream of a bigger and more prosperous store will come true and he thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy supplies (rice, sugar, oil, etc.) for his small convenience store

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama A. prepares kokonte with soup to sell in Abura. Agbeli mamu is the local name for powdered cassava and, when cooked, it is called kokonte. The colour turns brown after cooking. To get agbeli mamu, raw cassava is peeled, washed, cut into pieces and left to dry very well in the sun for a number of days. After drying, it is sent to the mill to be milled and left to cool after which it can be used for the kokonte. To cook the kokonte, she heats water to the boiling point and then begins to pour the flour into the water, stirring continuously (to avoid forming lumps) till it becomes firm enough to be eaten. Kokonte is normally eaten with groundnut soup and palm nut soup with any kind of fish or meat of your choice and / or taste. Ama has received junior high education. She is married and has six dependants. Her husband is a farmer and she has been selling kokonte for some time now. She helps her husband with the payment of school fees for educating their children. Her loan will be used to acquire more cassava to process into flour to cook for sale. She is hoping to use the new revenues from her business to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To acquire more cassava to process into flour to cook for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Medical expenses

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es:
Don Manuel es  un padre de familia de dos  hijos, de 34 años de edad, junto a su esposa administran una pequeña pulpería que desde hace varios años logro poner, con apoyo económico de su papa. Su casa es pequeña parte de concreto y madera, al poner la pulpería le quedo poco espacio para su privacidad, lo cual desea construir al lado un pequeño local para poner sola la pulpería y dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Y lograr estar cómodo con esta mejora. Entre las dificultades se le ha hecho difícil desde que se le robaron su caballo el cual era el medio de transporte para vender y hacer las compras.
Comprara materiales de construcción como: piedra, arena, cemento, hierro y madera para hacer el local. 
Con los financiamientos ha logrado las mejoras a largo plazo, lo que ha venido a mejorar la infraestructura de su casa.
texts.en:
Manuel is a 34-year-old father of two children. He and his wife run a small local store which they were able to open with the economic support of his father several years ago. Their home is small, part concrete and part wood. When they opened the store there, they did not have much space left for privacy; so they want to build a small area next to their home for the store, in order to offer better service to their customers. They will live more comfortably with this improvement. Among other problems, it has been difficult for them since their horse was stolen, as it was a mode of transportation to buy and sell merchandise. With this loan they will buy construction materials such as stone, sand, cement, iron and wood to build their store. With previous loans they have made long-term improvements to their house, which have improved the infrastructure of their home.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction materials for a store

loans.name: Unidos Venceremos Group

texts.en:
Bertha is the coordinator of her group, Unidos Venceremos (Together We Will Triumph), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti).

Bertha’s group is located in La Romana, a rural area of the country dedicated to the sugarcane harvest, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home there in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their one child.

Bertha is excited to be taking her fourth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her small grocery/general neighborhood store (colmado), by buying necessary products for sale like rice, diapers, beans, oil, fish, etc.

Bertha will use the profits to improve the well-being of her children by buying school supplies. She hopes to be able to buy a house in the future and to grow her business. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs for her small store such as rice, beans, diapers, fish etc.

loans.name: Por Siempre Alegres Group

texts.es:
En uno de los Centros Focales de Pro Mujer, Panamericana, se reúnen cada dos semanas la Asociación Comunal POR SIEMPRE ALEGRES. Su presidenta es Margarita H. de 22 años, comenta que es la primera vez que ingresa a conformar un grupo, tiene algo de temor pero con entusiasmo de mejorar y hacer crecer su negocio. 
Margarita tiene una tienda de barrio y con préstamo tiene planificado  comprar mercadería y surtir su negocio. 
Margarita se levanta muy temprano para atender a su clientela desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche.


Las demás  integrantes de esta Asociación tienen variados negocios que se dedican a la comercialización, producción y servicio.
texts.en:
The Por Siempre Alegres ("Forever Joyful") Group meets every two weeks in one of the centres of Pro Mujer Panamericana. Their president is Margarita H., 22 years old. She mentions that this is the first time she has led a group, and she is a little nervous, but enthusiastic to watch her business grow and improve. Margarita has a neighbourhood store and plans to use her loan to buy merchandise and stock her business. She gets up very early to serve her customers, from 8 am to 9 pm. The other group members have various businesses involved in marketing, production and services.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Raúl

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Raúl V. le está haciendo falta el piso de concreto en el patio trasero. 
Solicita el préstamo para poder comprar el material y pagarle a la persona que realizara la mejora. Desea que sus hijos tengan un lugar donde puedan salir a jugar.
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte de los ingresos que obtiene de su trabajo en el área de documentador de mercancía, en una agencia aduanal. 
Las personas que aparecen en la foto son la señora Laura Adriana Flores y sus dos hijos, es la familia del señor Raúl V., ya que se encontraba en su trabajo el día de la visita.
texts.en:
The patio behind Raúl’s house needs a concrete floor. He is asking for this loan in order to buy building materials and pay for labor. He wants his children to have a place to play. He plans to repay the loan with part of his income from his job as an inventory clerk for a customs agency. The people in the photograph are Raúl’s wife, Laura Adriana, and his two children. Raúl was at work when we visited his home.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvement

loans.name: Maritza Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña Maritza es una mujer muy  trabajadora, tiene la edad de 46 años, con ayuda de su esposo han logrado construir su casa, pero aun le falta mucha mejoras el cual harán a largo plazo, a través de los financiamiento. Doña Maritza tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de carne, pollo, arroz, azúcar, golosinas, el cual vende desde hace varios años para poder apoyar con lo gastos básicos de agua, luz. 

Las dificultades que se le dan, es que las ventas se ponen bajas y vende poco. Las mejoras que desea hacer es  cambiar unas hojas de zinc que están en mal estado, también  hacer el baño de concreto para una mejor higiene, y seguridad personal. Contenta ya que a través de estos préstamos ha logrado mejorar su casa, poco a poco y espera seguir adelante en un futuro para lograr los objetivos propuestos para un mejor bienestar familiar.
texts.en:
Maritza is 46 years old and a hard working woman. With her husband’s help, she has managed to have her house built, but it still needs many improvements, which they will make steadily, with the help of financing. Maritza has had a small business for several years, selling meat, poultry, rice, sugar, and snacks. She does this in order to help pay for basic services, such as electricity and water. Her biggest challenge has been that her sales have been low lately. The improvements she wants to make to her home include replacing some metal sheeting that is in bad shape and upgrading her bathroom to a concrete room, in order for it to be more secure and sanitary. She is happy that these loans have allowed her to improve her home little by little and expects to continue to move ahead with her goals to improve her family’s well being.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvement

loans.name: Susana Filomena

texts.es: Susana Filomena tiene 54 años y 3 hijos que trabajan de manera independiente. Esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos para su negocio.  Hace más de 11 años que se dedica a esta actividad económica como es la venta de comida, por lo que sus inicios se dan por la necesidad de proporcionar a su familia el alimento diario, por lo que no tenía mucho apoyo de sus familiares, pus solamente ella tenía que realizar las compras, la elaboración y la venta de la comida. A pesar de las situaciones que enfrento ella ha salido adelante  con su actividad. Este financiamiento es para la compra de arroz, aceite, frijoles, carne y frutas. Su deseo es seguir ampliando su negocio y mejorando su actividad.
texts.en:
Susana is 54 years old and has three children. This will not be her first business loan and she has been selling food for the past 11 years. She began because she needed to earn an income in order to support her family, because she did not have her extended family’s support. When she began she had to do all of the work herself. Despite these and other challenges, she has come out ahead and will use the money from this loan to buy rice, cooking oil, beans, meats, and fruit. She wants to continue to improve and expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ingredients
